en: There was a man in the land of Uz, whose name was Job; and that man was perfect and upright, and one that feared God, and turned away from evil.
hmr: Uz rama chun mi pakhat a um a, a hming chu Job a nih; chu mipa chu mi fel le tluong le, Pathien ṭi a suol nghatsan mi a nih;

en: And there were born unto him seven sons and three daughters.
hmr: Ama chun naupasal pasari le naunuhmei pathum a nei a.

en: His substance also was seven thousand sheep, and three thousand camels, and five hundred yoke of oxen, and five hundred she-asses, and a very great household; so that this man was the greatest of all the children of the east.
hmr: A ran ruol khawm chu berâm sâng sari, sanghâwngsei sâng thum, bâwngchal tuok za nga, sabengtung- pui za nga le insûng ropuitak el leh a nih; chuongchun, chu mipa chu khaw- sak rama mihai po po laia a ropui tak a nih.

en: And his sons went and held a feast in the house of each one upon his day; and they sent and called for their three sisters to eat and to drink with them.
hmr: A naupasalhai chu an hunbi peiah an inhaia fein, ruoi an ṭhe insâwk hlak a: mi an tir a, an farnu pathumhai chu anni le faa dâwn dingin an ko hlak a.

en: And it was so, when the days of their feasting were gone about, that Job sent and sanctified them, and rose up early in the morning, and offered burnt-offerings according to the number of them all: for Job said, It may be that my sons have sinned, and renounced God in their hearts. Thus did Job continually.
hmr: Chun, an ruoiṭhena nihai vêl chu a kim pha chun Job chun ân chah a, anni chu a hlânthieng hlak a; zîngkâr inhmatakin a tho a, an rênga anni nizât hming kimin pumrawhmang thilinhlânhai ân hlân a: Job chun, “Ka naupasalhai hin thil lo suksuol- in, an lungrilhaiah Pathien hrilsie hlau rawi an tih,” a ti sih a. Chuong ang chun Job chun a thaw rawp hlak a.

en: Now it came to pass on the day when the sons of God came to present themselves before Jehovah, that Satan also came among them.
hmr: Tuhin Pathien naupahai chu LALPA hmaa inlang dinga an hung ni a um a; Setan khawm anni lai a hung veh a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Satan, Whence comest thou? Then Satan answered Jehovah, and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.
hmr: LALPA chun Setan kuoma chun, “Nang khâwtienga inthawka hung am i na?” a ta. Setan chun LALPA chu a dawn a, “Hnuoia kân vâk vêlnaa le chutaka a suk a tunga inlawnnaa inthawkin,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah said unto Satan, Hast thou considered my servant Job? for there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one that feareth God, and turneth away from evil.
hmr: Chun, LALPA chun Setan kuoma chun, “Ka siehlaw Job hi i ngaituo hlak am? Hnuoi chunga hin ama anga mi fel le, mi tluong le, Pathien ṭi mi le, suol nghatsan mi an um si nawh a,” a tih a.

en: Then Satan answered Jehovah, and said, Doth Job fear God for nought?
hmr: Setan chun LALPA chu a dawn a, “Job chun Pathien chu teplo elin a ṭi ding maw chu?

en: Hast not thou made a hedge about him, and about his house, and about all that he hath, on every side? thou hast blessed the work of his hands, and his substance is increased in the land.
hmr: Ama vêla le, a in le a nei po po, a sîr tina chun paldâi i siempêk a ni naw am a nih? A kuthai sinthaw chu mal i sâwm a, a ran ruol chu hi rama hin a hung pung tah a.

en: But put forth thy hand now, and touch all that he hath, and he will renounce thee to thy face.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tuhin i kut phar la, a thil nei po po chu tâwk la, i hmâisanah hrilse ngei ngei a ti che,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah said unto Satan, Behold, all that he hath is in thy power; only upon himself put not forth thy hand. So Satan went forth from the presence of Jehovah.
hmr: LALPA chun Setan kuoma chun, “Ngai ta, a thil nei po pohai chu i thuneina hnuoia um an nih; ama chunga chau chun i kut chu inlet naw rawh,” a ta. Chuongchun, Setan chu LALPA hmâihmaa inthawk chun a fe suok tah a.

en: And it fell on a day when his sons and his daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house,
hmr: Chun, ni khat chu a naupa- salhai le a naunuhmeihai chun an unaupa a upa tak ina an fâk a, uoin an dâwn laiin,

en: that there came a messenger unto Job, and said, The oxen were plowing, and the asses feeding beside them;
hmr: Job kuoma chun thangko a hung tah a, “Bâwngchalhai chun hnuoi an inlet a, an sîra chun sabeng- tunghai chu an tlah a;

en: and the Sabeans fell upon them, and took them away: yea, they have slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
hmr: Seba mihaiin anni an thawh a, an lâk rip el a; anih, siehlawhai chu kâwlhnâm ngeiin an that a; chuong- chun, nangma hril ding chein kei chau hi ka hung inrel suok a nih,” a ta.

en: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The fire of God is fallen from heaven, and hath burned up the sheep and the servants, and consumed them; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
hmr: Ama chun a la hril zing laiin mi dang khawm a hung veh a, “Vâna inthawkin Pathien mei a hung tla a, berâm ruol le siehlawhai chu a kâng a, a kâng hmang vawng tâwl el a; chuongchun, kei chau a hril ding chein ka hung suok a nih,” a ta.

en: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, The Chaldeans made three bands, and fell upon the camels, and have taken them away, yea, and slain the servants with the edge of the sword; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
hmr: Ama chun a la hril lai zing chun mi dang a hung ve nâwk a, “Kaldaihai chu pâwl thumin an insiem a, sa- nghâwngseihai chu an thawh a, anni chu an lâk hmang rip el a; kâwlhnâm ngeiin siehlawhai chu an that a: a hril ding chein kei chau ka hung inrel suok a nih,” a ta.

en: While he was yet speaking, there came also another, and said, Thy sons and thy daughters were eating and drinking wine in their eldest brother’s house;
hmr: A la hril lai zing chun mi dang khawm a hung nâwk veh a, “I naupa- salhai le i naunuhmeihai chu an unaupa upa tak inah uoin an dâwnin an fâk a:

en: and, behold, there came a great wind from the wilderness, and smote the four corners of the house, and it fell upon the young men, and they are dead; and I only am escaped alone to tell thee.
hmr: ngai ta, thlalêr tienga inthawk- in thli nasatak el a hung a, in kil lia chun a mût a, tlangvâlhai chu a tlûk khum a, an thi vawng tah a; a hril ding chein kei chau hi ka hung suok a nih,” a ta.

en: Then Job arose, and rent his robe, and shaved his head, and fell down upon the ground, and worshipped;
hmr: Chun, Job chu a tho a, a puon a keithlêr a, a lu a vâwkawl a, hnuoi chunga bawkkhupin Pathien chibai a bûk tah a.

en: and he said, Naked came I out of my mother’s womb, and naked shall I return thither: Jehovah gave, and Jehovah hath taken away; blessed be the name of Jehovah.
hmr: “Ka nu phîng sûnga inthawkin saruokin ka hung suok a, saruok bawkin kîr nâwk ka tih; LALPA chun a pêk a, LALPA chun a lâk hmang nâwk tah a ni chu; LALPA hming chu inpâkin um raw se,” a ta.

en: In all this Job sinned not, nor charged God foolishly.
hmr: Hieng thil po poa hin Job chun a suksuol nawh a, invêtthlâktakin Pathien chu a mawsiet bawk nawh.

en: My soul is weary of my life; I will give free course to my complaint; I will speak in the bitterness of my soul.
hmr: “Ka thlâ hin ka hringna hi a nghawk a; Ka nuom tâwkin sawisêl ka tih, Ka lungril rimsiknain thu hril ka tih.

en: I will say unto God, Do not condemn me; Show me wherefore thou contendest with me.
hmr: Pathien kuoma chun hieng hin tîng ka ta, Thiemnaw mîn changtir naw la, Keimaa hin ieng ang am i lungawi zâwng a ni mîn entir lem rawh.

en: Is it good unto thee that thou shouldest oppress, That thou shouldest despise the work of thy hands, And shine upon the counsel of the wicked?
hmr: Nanga ngaiin, i nêksâwr a, I kut sinthawhai chu i hmusit a, Mi rilohai inrâwnna i sukvar chu a ṭha am a nih?

en: Hast thou eyes of flesh? Or seest thou as man seeth?
hmr: Nang chun tisa mithai chu i neiin, Annawleh, i kumhai chu mihriemin an hmu angin i hmu am a nih?

en: Are thy days as the days of man, Or thy years as man’s days,
hmr: I nihai chu mihriemhai nihai ang am an nih? Annawleh, i kumhai chu mihriem kumhai ang am an nih?

en: That thou inquirest after mine iniquity, And searchest after my sin,
hmr: Ka rîtlonahai i sui ngiel a, Ka suolna khawm i zawng rak el chu?

en: Although thou knowest that I am not wicked, And there is none that can deliver out of thy hand?
hmr: Mi rilo ka ni nawh a, I kuta inthawka mi la suok thei tukhawm an um nawh ti hre zing siin?

en: Thy hands have framed me and fashioned me Together round about; yet thou dost destroy me.
hmr: I kuthai chun a mi riruongin a mi lo siembâwl vawng tah a, Anachu nangin i mi suksiet el hi.

en: Remember, I beseech thee, that thou hast fashioned me as clay; And wilt thou bring me into dust again?
hmr: Hi hi hre zing rawh, ka ngên che hi, nang chun pilpawk angin i mi lo siembâwl tah a, Pilvuta bawk i mi ṭhuoi nâwk el ding a ni maw?

en: Hast thou not poured me out as milk, And curdled me like cheese?
hmr: Nang chun nênetui anga mi bunthlain, Nênetui kîng angin i mi hmet ta ni lo am a nih?

en: Thou hast clothed me with skin and flesh, And knit me together with bones and sinews.
hmr: Nang chun vun le taksain i mi lo thuom tah a, Thahruihai le ruhai chun i mi ṭhui khâwm tah.

en: Thou hast granted me life and lovingkindness; And thy visitation hath preserved my spirit.
hmr: Hringna le ditsakna i mi lo phalpêk tah a, I vênghimna chun ka thlarau chu a lo hum a.

en: Yet these things thou didst hide in thy heart; I know that this is with thee:
hmr: Amiruokchu, hieng thilhai hi nang chun i lungrila chun i thup a, Hi hi i kuomah a um ti ka hriet a nih.

en: If I sin, then thou markest me, And thou wilt not acquit me from mine iniquity.
hmr: Ka lo suol chun, nangin i mîn chik a, Ka khawhlonaa inthawk chun thiem i mîn changtir ngai nawh.

en: If I be wicked, woe unto me; And if I be righteous, yet shall I not lift up my head; Being filled with ignominy, And looking upon mine affliction.
hmr: Mi rilo ka ni chun, ka chung a rik a! Mi fel ni lang khawm ka lu ling naw bawk ka tih, Muolphonain ka sip a, ka tuornahai ka hmu zing leiin.

en: And if my head exalt itself, thou huntest me as a lion; And again thou showest thyself marvellous upon me.
hmr: Ka lu hi ama le ama ân chawimawi chun, sakeibaknei angin i mi pêl a, Ka chunga chun nang chu maktakin i hung inentir a.

en: Thou renewest thy witnesses against me, And increasest thine indignation upon me: Changes and warfare are with me.
hmr: Ka chunga chun i thuhretuhai chu i hung sukthar a, Ka chungah i lunginsenna i sukpung a, Mi dotu pâwl dang dang i hung inumtir a.

en: Wherefore then hast thou brought me forth out of the womb? I had given up the ghost, and no eye had seen me.
hmr: Chuong a ni chun iengdinga sula inthawk chun i mi lo lâk suok am a na? Thlarau lo inthla ta lang mitin a mi hmu naw ding bah.

en: I should have been as though I had not been; I should have been carried from the womb to the grave.
hmr: Kei chu lo um ta lo ang nîng ka ta, Sula inthawk chun thlânah lâk hmangin lo um tâng ka tih.

en: Are not my days few? cease then, And let me alone, that I may take comfort a little,
hmr: Ka nihai a tlâwm hle an nâwm a nih? Tâwp el raw se, Chitêa ka thlamuong dep theina dingin mâkhâtin mîn umtir el rawh.

en: Before I go whence I shall not return, Even to the land of darkness and of the shadow of death;
hmr: Ka hung kîr nâwk nawna dinga ka fe hma hin, Thina hlim le inthimna ram ngeia ka fe hma hin.

en: The land dark as midnight, The land of the shadow of death, without any order, And where the light is as midnight.
hmr: Inthimna ngawta inthim sâmup ram, Thupêk hrim um lo, thina hlim ram; Var khawm inthimna ang nina hmun chu,” tiin.

en: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
hmr: Chun, Zophar Naamath mi chun a dawn a, a hril tah a;

en: Should not the multitude of words be answered? And should a man full of talk be justified?
hmr: “Thu tamtakhai hi dawn a ni ngei naw ding am a nih? Mi ṭawng tam chu thiem inchangtir a ni ding am a nih?

en: Should thy boastings make men hold their peace? And when thou mockest, shall no man make thee ashamed?
hmr: Chatlakloa i ṭawng hin mihai ân to ṭawktir ding am a nih? Thamlo taka i ṭawng hin tukhawmin an sukzak naw ding che i ring maw?

en: For thou sayest, My doctrine is pure, And I am clean in thine eyes.
hmr: ‘Ka thuring chu ân thiengin, I mithmua chun kân thieng a nih,’ i ti sih a.

en: But oh that God would speak, And open his lips against thee,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, aw, Pathien chun hung hrilin, Nanga kalin a hmûrhai chu hung inchângtir ve sienla;

en: And that he would show thee the secrets of wisdom! For he is manifold in understanding. Know therefore that God exacteth of thee less than thine iniquity deserveth.
hmr: Varna thurûkhai chu ân entir ding che bah! Varna chu sîr tamtak a ni si a, Pathien chun i khawhlonain a phu nêka nêp lemin a thaw che a nih ti hre rawh.

en: Canst thou by searching find out God? Canst thou find out the Almighty unto perfection?
hmr: A zawnga zawng ngawtin Pathien thil inthûkhai chu i hmu suok thei ding am a nih? Iengkimthawthei chu a famkimin i hmu suok thei ding am a nih?

en: It is high as heaven; what canst thou do? Deeper than Sheol; what canst thou know?
hmr: Vân ang ela insâng a nih; nangin ieng am thaw thei i ta? Seol nêka inthûk lem a nih; nangin ieng am hre thei i ta?

en: The measure thereof is longer than the earth, And broader than the sea.
hmr: Chu chu lienzie chu leihnuoi nêkin a sei lemin; Tuisuoriet nêkin a lien lem a nih.

en: If he pass through, and shut up, And call unto judgment, then who can hinder him?
hmr: Ama chu a fêthleng a, a khârkhip a, A ko khâwm chun tuin am dang thei an ta?

en: For he knoweth false men: He seeth iniquity also, even though he consider it not.
hmr: Mi teplohai chu a hrietin, A ngaituo naw khawma, khawhlonahai chu a hmu sih a.

en: But vain man is void of understanding, Yea, man is born as a wild ass’s colt.
hmr: Ram sabengtungtê mihriema a pieng phaleh, Mi teplo chun hrietthiemna nei chau a tih.

en: If thou set thy heart aright, And stretch out thy hands toward him;
hmr: I lungril chu i siem dik a, Ama tiengah i kuthai i phar chun;

en: If iniquity be in thy hand, put it far away, And let not unrighteousness dwell in thy tents.
hmr: I kuta chun khawhlona a um ruok chun, hlatakah sie dai rawh, I puon inahai chun fel nawna inchêngtir naw la;

en: Surely then shalt thou lift up thy face without spot; Yea, thou shalt be stedfast, and shalt not fear:
hmr: Chun, matheiloin i hmai chu kaidum um hlek loin nghâng i ta, Anih, dettakin um i ta, ṭi naw ti ni.

en: For thou shalt forget thy misery; Thou shalt remember it as waters that are passed away,
hmr: I rinum tuorhai chu i theinghil ta âwm sih a; Tui luong hmang tahai ang chau chun hre zing i tih.

en: And thy life shall be clearer than the noonday; Though there be darkness, it shall be as the morning.
hmr: Chun, i hringna chu sûnchang lai nêkin hung fie lem a ta, Inthimna um sien khawm, zîngkâr ang ni tâng a tih.

en: And thou shalt be secure, because there is hope; Yea, thou shalt search about thee, and shalt take thy rest in safety.
hmr: Chun, beiseina a um leiin, nang chu him tâng i ta, Anih, nangma le nangma inzawng suok i ta, himtakin sâwldam tâng i tih.

en: Also thou shalt lie down, and none shall make thee afraid; Yea, many shall make suit unto thee.
hmr: Zâl i ta, tukhawma suklâu bawk naw ni hai che; Anih, mi tamtakin nangma le inremna hung siem an tih.

en: But the eyes of the wicked shall fail, And they shall have no way to flee; And their hope shall be the giving up of the ghost.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mi rilo mithai chu hung hlawsam a ta, Tlân hmangna ding lampui khawm nei naw ni hai, An beiseina khawm chu thlarau inthla ang chu nîng a tih,” tiin.

en: Then Job answered and said,
hmr: Chun, Job chun a dawn a, a hril tah a:

en: No doubt but ye are the people, And wisdom shall die with you.
hmr: “Mihriem chau in na, Varna chu in ruolin thi ve el a tih ti hi ringhla um lo a na.

en: But I have understanding as well as you; I am not inferior to you: Yea, who knoweth not such things as these?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, nangni ang bawkin hrietthiemna ka nei veh a, Nangni nêkin kân hnuoi bîk nawh: Anih, hieng thilhai ang hi tuin am hre nâwng an ta?

en: I am as one that is a laughing-stock to his neighbor, I who called upon God, and he answered: The just, the perfect man is a laughing-stock.
hmr: Ka ruolhai ta dingin nuizatbûr ka hung ni tah a, Pathien ka koin, mi dawn sien khawm, Mi fel le demkailo ni lang khawm nuizatbûr el ka ni ta hi.

en: In the thought of him that is at ease there is contempt for misfortune; It is ready for them whose foot slippeth.
hmr: Mi inhawitirhai ta ding chun vângduoina chu hmusitum a na; Mi a kehai intawlthlu ṭêp ta ding chun inzosa a nih.

en: The tents of robbers prosper, And they that provoke God are secure; Into whose hand God bringeth abundantly.
hmr: Inruhmanghai puon inhai chu a hung hlawtling a, Pathien suklungsentuhai chu an him bawk a, Chuonghai kuta chun Pathien chun tamtakin a hung vur a.

en: But ask now the beasts, and they shall teach thee; And the birds of the heavens, and they shall tell thee:
hmr: Amiruokchu, tuhin ramsahai khawm chu indawn la, inchûktir an ti che; Chunglêng vatehai khawm chu indawn la hril an ti che.

en: Or speak to the earth, and it shall teach thee; And the fishes of the sea shall declare unto thee.
hmr: Annawleh, hnuoi kuoma chun thu hril la, inchûktir a ti che, Tuisuorieta ngahai khawm chun i kuomah hrillang an tih.

en: Who knoweth not in all these, That the hand of Jehovah hath wrought this,
hmr: Hienghai po poa hin, Lalpa kut chun hi hi a thaw a nih ti hre naw tu am um an ta?

en: In whose hand is the soul of every living thing, And the breath of all mankind?
hmr: Ama kuta chun thilhring po po hringna chu a um a, Mi chi tinrênghai thlarau leh.

en: Doth not the ear try words, Even as the palate tasteth its food?
hmr: Na hin thuhai chu a fie ngai naw am a ni, Dangin bu chu ân tem ang el hin?

en: With aged men is wisdom, And in length of days understanding.
hmr: Upaa chun varna a um a, Nihai sâwtah hrietthiemna a um bawk a.

en: With God is wisdom and might; He hath counsel and understanding.
hmr: Amaa chun varna le hrâtna a um a, Ama chun hrietthiemna le remhrietna a nei.

en: Behold, he breaketh down, and it cannot be built again; He shutteth up a man, and there can be no opening.
hmr: Ngai ta, a suksiet a, siemṭhat thei ruol an ta nawh a; Mihriem chu a khârkhip a, ân hawngna a um thei nawh a.

en: Behold, he withholdeth the waters, and they dry up; Again, he sendeth them out, and they overturn the earth.
hmr: Ngai ta, tuihai chu a chelngîr a, an kang tah a; A hung tir nâwk thung a, hnuoi chu an inkhum a.

en: With him is strength and wisdom; The deceived and the deceiver are his.
hmr: Amaa chun hrâtna le varna famkim chu a um a, Hlêma um le hlêmtu khawm chu ama ta bawk a nih.

en: He leadeth counsellors away stripped, And judges maketh he fools.
hmr: Inrâwnkhâwmhai chu a ṭhuoi hmangin a suksiet a; Rorêltuhai chu invêt ruolah a siem tah a.

en: He looseth the bond of kings, And he bindeth their loins with a girdle.
hmr: Lalhai khuopna chu a sût a; An kâwnghai chu kâwngkhiin a khitpêk a,

en: He leadeth priests away stripped, And overthroweth the mighty.
hmr: Thiempuhai chu ṭhuoi hmangin a suksiet a; Mi hrât chu a nam thlûk bawk a.

en: He removeth the speech of the trusty, And taketh away the understanding of the elders.
hmr: Mi ringum ṭawnghai chu a sawn hmang a; Upahai hrietthiemna chu a lâk hmang bawk a.

en: He poureth contempt upon princes, And looseth the belt of the strong.
hmr: Lal nauhai chunga chun hmusitumna a buok a, Mi hrât kâwngchûn chu a sûtpêk bawk a.

en: He uncovereth deep things out of darkness, And bringeth out to light the shadow of death.
hmr: Inthima inthawkin thil inthûktakhai chu a hmu suok a; Thina varuom chu varah a hung lâk suok tah a.

en: He increaseth the nations, and he destroyeth them: He enlargeth the nations, and he leadeth them captive.
hmr: Hnamhai chu a hung sukpung a, anni a sukbohmang tah a; Hnamhai chu a hung suklien a, anni a ṭhuoi hmang hlak a.

en: He taketh away understanding from the chiefs of the people of the earth, And causeth them to wander in a wilderness where there is no way.
hmr: Hnuoia mipuihai lalhai lungril chu a lâk hmang a, Thlalêr hmun lampui um nawna hmuna chun ân vâktir hlak.

en: They grope in the dark without light; And he maketh them to stagger like a drunken man.
hmr: Inthima chun var ṭhang loin an inmai a, Mi, zu inrui ang ela pêm dingin anni a siem hlak.”

en: Lo, mine eye hath seen all this, Mine ear hath heard and understood it.
hmr: “Ngai ta, hi po po hi ka mit chun a hmu a nih, Ka na chun a hriet a, a ngâina khawm ka hriet tah.

en: What ye know, the same do I know also: I am not inferior unto you.
hmr: In hriet ang ang chu kei khawmin ka hriet a: Nangni nêkin kân hnuoi bîk nawh.

en: Surely I would speak to the Almighty, And I desire to reason with God.
hmr: Amiruokchu, Iengkimthawthei kuoma chun thuhril ka nuom a, Pathien le ngaituo hmunkhat chu ka nuom a nih.

en: But ye are forgers of lies; Ye are all physicians of no value.
hmr: Khêlthuahai khêlhriltuhai chau in ni hi; Damdawi thiem mi ṭhangkaina um si lohai vawng in nih.

en: Oh that ye would altogether hold your peace! And it would be your wisdom.
hmr: Aw, in rêngin to ṭawk ṭawk lem unla chu! In varna ni lem a tih.

en: Hear now my reasoning, And hearken to the pleadings of my lips.
hmr: “Ka ngaituona hi hre unla, Ka hmûrhaiin a hninahai chu ngai ta u.

en: Will ye speak unrighteously for God, And talk deceitfully for him?
hmr: Pathien ta ding chun fel lotaka thu hrilin, Ama ta ding chun hmusitumtakin in ṭawng ding maw?

en: Will ye show partiality to him? Will ye contend for God?
hmr: A mi hi in inza naw ding am a nih? Pathien ta ding chun in kal ding maw?

en: Is it good that he should search you out? Or as one deceiveth a man, will ye deceive him?
hmr: A zawng suok el cheu chu a ṭha am a nih? Annawleh, miin mi dang a hlêm angin, ama chu in hlêm el ding maw?

en: He will surely reprove you, If ye do secretly show partiality.
hmr: Ama chun matheiloin kâwk a ti cheu, Mihai chu inrûka in ditsak bîk chun.

en: Shall not his majesty make you afraid, And his dread fall upon you?
hmr: A ṭhat famkimna chun a sukṭi cheuin, A ṭitumna chu in chungah a tla naw ding am a nih?

en: Your memorable sayings are proverbs of ashes, Your defences are defences of clay.
hmr: In thuhril hriet zing dinghai hlak chu vut thuvarhai an na, in inhumna hlak chu pilpawk inhumna a nih.

en: Hold your peace, let me alone, that I may speak; And let come on me what will.
hmr: To ṭawk unla, makhâtin mîn umtir ro, thu ka hril theina dingin, Ieng po khawm ka chungah tlung el raw se.

en: Wherefore should I take my flesh in my teeth, And put my life in my hand?
hmr: Iengkhawm tlung sien, ka taksa chu ka hahaia sein, Ka hringna chu ka kutah ka sie el dîm a nih?

en: Behold, he will slay me; I have no hope: Nevertheless I will maintain my ways before him.
hmr: Ama chun mi sukhlum sien khawm, ama chu la beisei rawp ka tih. A hmabulah ka thiemna thu ka la hril ding a ni si a.

en: This also shall be my salvation, That a godless man shall not come before him.
hmr: Hi hi ka sandamna chu nîng a ta; Pathien ngaisak naw mi chu a hmaa hin a hung âwm si nawh a.

en: Hear diligently my speech, And let my declaration be in your ears.
hmr: Nguntakin ka thuhrilhai hi ngai unla, Ka hrilfiena hi in nahaia chun lût raw se.

en: Behold now, I have set my cause in order; I know that I am righteous.
hmr: Tuhin, ngai ta u, ka chungthua thu ka siemfel tah a, Thiem chang ka tih ti ka hriet.

en: Who is he that will contend with me? For then would I hold my peace and give up the ghost.
hmr: Tuin am mi sêl a ta? Tuhin to ṭawk ka ta,ka thlarau kân thla ding a ni sih a.

en: Only do not two things unto me; Then will I not hide myself from thy face:
hmr: Thil pahni hi ka chungah thaw naw la, Chuongchun, i hmaa inthawkin inbihmang naw ning.

en: Withdraw thy hand far from me; And let not thy terror make me afraid.
hmr: Keimaa inthawkin i kut chu hlatakah la hmang la, I ṭiumna chun mi suklâu ta naw raw se.

en: Then call thou, and I will answer; Or let me speak, and answer thou me.
hmr: Chun, mi hung ko la, hung dawn ka ta; Annawleh, thu min hriltir la, nangin mi hung dawn rawh.

en: How many are mine iniquities and sins? Make me to know my transgression and my sin.
hmr: Ka suolnahai le ka khawhlonahai chu iengzât am an na? Ka suolna le ka bawsietna chu mîn hriettir rawh.

en: Wherefore hidest thou thy face, And holdest me for thine enemy?
hmr: Iengdinga nangin i hmai i thup a, I hmêlma anga i mi ngai am?

en: Wilt thou harass a driven leaf? And wilt thou pursue the dry stubble?
hmr: Hna inhnîng inhnîng hi i thlam el ding maw? Bupâwl bul ṭâwl chu i hnawt i hnawt ding maw?

en: For thou writest bitter things against me, And makest me to inherit the iniquities of my youth:
hmr: Nang chun ka chungah thil khatakhai chu i ziek a, Ka tleirâwl lai khawhlonahai ro chu hluo dingin i mi siem a.

en: Thou puttest my feet also in the stocks, And markest all my paths; Thou settest a bound to the soles of my feet:
hmr: Ka kehai chu kawl în buntir a; Ka lampuihai chu în chik vawng a, Ka kepha vêl po poa chun ramri i siekhum bawk a.

en: Though I am like a rotten thing that consumeth, Like a garment that is moth-eaten.
hmr: Mi chu thil hmawn bohmang el hlak ang a nih, Silfên hângthim ifâksiet ang chu.

en: Man, that is born of a woman, Is of few days, and full of trouble.
hmr: “Mi nuhmei inei taphawt chu, Ni sâwtnawtêa ding, buoinaa sip a nih.

en: He cometh forth like a flower, and is cut down: He fleeth also as a shadow, and continueth not.
hmr: Pâr angin a hung suok a, a vuoi hlak, Hlim angin a tlân a, a um zing ngai nawh.

en: And dost thou open thine eyes upon such a one, And bringest me into judgment with thee?
hmr: Mi chuong ang mi chunga chun i mit i mengin, Nangma le rorêlnaa chun i mi ṭhuoi a ni maw?

en: Who can bring a clean thing out of an unclean? not one.
hmr: Tuin am thil inthieng nawa inthawkin thil inthieng la suok thei an ta? Tukhawma thei naw ni hai.

en: Seeing his days are determined, The number of his months is with thee, And thou hast appointed his bounds that he cannot pass;
hmr: A nihai chu biruot a na, a thla ni zâthai khawm chu nangma kuomah a um a, Nang chun a fe pei thei nawna dingin a ramrihai chu i khang tâk hnung chu.

en: Look away from him, that he may rest, Till he shall accomplish, as a hireling, his day.
hmr: A châwl theina dingin, ama nghatsan rawh, Inhlawfa anga a ni chu a suktling hmakhat chun.

en: For there is hope of a tree, If it be cut down, that it will sprout again, And that the tender branch thereof will not cease.
hmr: Thing ta ding chun beiseina a um, phûr ni sien khawm inder nâwk a tih; Chun, chu a kâu innohai chu vuoi naw ni.

en: Though the root thereof wax old in the earth, And the stock thereof die in the ground;
hmr: A zung chu hnuoia chun hung tar sienla khawm, A kûng chu leihnuoia chun thi sien khawm,

en: Yet through the scent of water it will bud, And put forth boughs like a plant.
hmr: Tui riminhnikna lei chun la hung inder a ta, Thil phun angin a zârhai hung zâr suok a tih.

en: But man dieth, and is laid low: Yea, man giveth up the ghost, and where is he?
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, mihriem chu a thih a, a rîral tah a; Anih, mihriem chun a thlarau ân thlah a, khâwlai am a um ta leh?

en: As the waters fail from the sea, And the river wasteth and drieth up;
hmr: Tuihai chu tuisuorieta inthawka a fe hmang a, Vadung chu a hung kang a, a hung ṭâwl angin;

en: So man lieth down and riseth not: Till the heavens be no more, they shall not awake, Nor be roused out of their sleep.
hmr: Chuong ang chun mihriem chu a zâl a, a thonâwk ta nawh; Vânhai chu a um naw hmakhat chun, tho ta naw ni hai a, An innaa inthawk chun keitho ni bawk naw ni hai.

en: Oh that thou wouldest hide me in Sheol, That thou wouldest keep me secret, until thy wrath be past, That thou wouldest appoint me a set time, and remember me!
hmr: “Aw, Seola chun mi lo thup tah ni la chu, I lunginsenna a fe hmang hmakhat chu inrûkin mi lo kawl i ta, Hun bîk mi ruotpêkin, i mi hriet zing ding bah!

en: If a man die, shall he live again? All the days of my warfare would I wait, Till my release should come.
hmr: Mi a thi chun a hring nâwk ding am a nih? Ka nihai po po chu nghâk ka tih, Insuoa ka umna chu a hung tlung hmakhat chun.

en: Thou wouldest call, and I would answer thee: Thou wouldest have a desire to the work of thy hands.
hmr: Nangin mi hung ko i ta, keiin lo dawn ka ti che, I kuthai sinthaw chu ditna i nei ding annâwm.

en: But now thou numberest my steps: Dost thou not watch over my sin?
hmr: Amiruokchu, tuhin nang chun ka kalchawihai i tiemin, Ka suolna chu i enthlit zing naw am a nih?

en: My transgression is sealed up in a bag, And thou fastenest up mine iniquity.
hmr: Ka bawsietna chu ipa khitkhum a na, Nangin ka khawhlona chu i ṭhuikhum a.

en: But the mountain falling cometh to nought; And the rock is removed out of its place;
hmr: Matheiloin tlâng chu chimin teplo hung nîng a ta, Lungpui khawm chu a hmuna inthawka sawn nîng a tih.

en: The waters wear the stones; The overflowings thereof wash away the dust of the earth: So thou destroyest the hope of man.
hmr: Tuihai chun lunghai chu an hrût hek a, Tui inkhâwhai chun hnuoia pil chu an lên hmang a, Chun, nang chun mihriem beiseina chu i sukbo a.

en: Thou prevailest for ever against him, and he passeth; Thou changest his countenance, and sendest him away.
hmr: Ama chu kumkhuoin i hneha, ama chu a fê hmang ta a, A hmêlput chu i thleng a, i tir hmang tah a.

en: His sons come to honor, and he knoweth it not; And they are brought low, but he perceiveth it not of them.
hmr: A naupasalhai chu inzâumin an hung um a, ama chun a hriet nawh a, Chun, siehnuoi an hung na, a hriet chuong bawk nawh.

en: But his flesh upon him hath pain, And his soul within him mourneth.
hmr: Amiruokchu, a tisa chun a chunga chun natna a nei a, Chun, a lungril chu a sûnga chun ân rûm bawk a,” tiin.

en: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
hmr: Chun, Eliphaz Teman mi chun a dawn a, a hril tah a:

en: Should a wise man make answer with vain knowledge, And fill himself with the east wind?
hmr: “Mi var chun hrietna teplo meimeia inthawka dawnna siemin, A phîng chu sakthliin a suksip ding am a nih?

en: Should he reason with unprofitable talk, Or with speeches wherewith he can do no good?
hmr: Hohlimna hmangtlâk lo mei mei le chun amani, Annawleh, ṭawng, thil ṭha thawna thei si lohai le chun a hril ding am a nih?

en: Yea, thou doest away with fear, And hinderest devotion before God.
hmr: Anih, ṭitna chu i sie hmang tah a, Pathien hmaa ṭawngṭâina chu i suktlâwm a.

en: For thine iniquity teacheth thy mouth, And thou choosest the tongue of the crafty.
hmr: I khawhlona chun i bau chu ân chûktir sih a. Mi vervêkhai lei chu i thlang lem tah a nih.

en: Thine own mouth condemneth thee, and not I; Yea, thine own lips testify against thee.
hmr: Kei ni loin, nanga ṭawngbau ngei chun thiemnaw ân changtir cheh a, Anih, i hmûrhai ngei chun maw ân phur che a nih.

en: Art thou the first man that was born? Or wast thou brought forth before the hills?
hmr: “Nang chu mihriem laia pieng hmasa tak am i nih? Annawleh, tlânghai um hmain nang chu lâk suok i ni tâm a nih?

en: Hast thou heard the secret counsel of God? And dost thou limit wisdom to thyself?
hmr: Pathien thurâwn rûk chu i hriet ta hlak am a nih? Varna chu nangmaa chun i ip hlak am a nih?

en: What knowest thou, that we know not? What understandest thou, which is not in us?
hmr: Kan hriet naw ieng am i hriet bîk a? Keinia umlo hi, ieng am i hriet bîk a?

en: With us are both the gray-headed and the very aged men, Much elder than thy father.
hmr: Ei kuoma hai hi lu inṭuok, mi upatak ve ve, I pa nêka nasataka upa ve ve an nih.

en: Are the consolations of God too small for thee, Even the word that is gentle toward thee?
hmr: Pathien hnêmnahai che le, Thu i kuoma zainêmtaka hung thaw hi i ta dingin a chîn taluo a ni maw?

en: Why doth thy heart carry thee away? And why do thine eyes flash,
hmr: Iengdinga i lungrilin a phur hmang che am a na? I mithai chu iengdinga a hung inlir el am a na?

en: That against God thou turnest thy spirit, And lettest words go out of thy mouth?
hmr: I lungril chu Pathien chungah în hertir a, Chuong ang thuhai chu i baua inthawka în suoktir el chu?

en: What is man, that he should be clean? And he that is born of a woman, that he should be righteous?
hmr: Mihriem chu inthieng dingin ieng am a na? Nuhmei inei chun fel ni dingin ieng am a ni leh?

en: Behold, he putteth no trust in his holy ones; Yea, the heavens are not clean in his sight:
hmr: Ngai ta, a mi inthienghai chunga chun ringna ân nghat nawh a, Anih, a vânhai khawm chu a mithmua chun ân thieng naw a nih.

en: How much less one that is abominable and corrupt, A man that drinketh iniquity like water!
hmr: Mî, khawhlona tui anga dâwntu chu, Tirdak a va umin a va pawrche zuol âwm de!

en: I will show thee, hear thou me; And that which I have seen I will declare
hmr: Mi ngaithla la, hril ka ti che, Thil ka ihmu chu hril ka tih,

en: (Which wise men have told From their fathers, and have not hid it;
hmr: Mi varhaiin an ihril, An pahaiin an kuoma an ip ngai naw;

en: Unto whom alone the land was given, And no stranger passed among them):
hmr: Chuong mihai kuoma chun ram chu pêk a na, Anni lai hmêlmak mi an fe ve nawh.

en: The wicked man travaileth with pain all his days, Even the number of years that are laid up for the oppressor.
hmr: Mi rilo chu a nihai po poa chun nauhase tuorin a um a, Nêksâwrtuhai ta dinga kumhai nizât siekhâwla a um sûng chun.

en: A sound of terrors is in his ears; In prosperity the destroyer shall come upon him.
hmr: Inlâuna rihai chu a naa chun a châm a; A tluongtlung laiin suksetu chu a chungah hung tlung a tih.

en: He believeth not that he shall return out of darkness, And he is waited for of the sword.
hmr: Inthima inthawk chun hung kîr dingin ân ring nawh a; Kâwlhnâm chu a nghâk zing a.

en: He wandereth abroad for bread, saying, Where is it? He knoweth that the day of darkness is ready at his hand.
hmr: ‘Khâwlai am a um a?’ tiin bu zawngin ân vâk ân vâk a; Inthimna ni chu a kuta chun ân zo zing a nih ti a hriet a.

en: Distress and anguish make him afraid; They prevail against him, as a king ready to the battle.
hmr: Rimsikna le lungngainahai chun ama a sukṭih a; Lal indo dinga inzosa hieu angin ama chu an inhuol a,

en: Because he hath stretched out his hand against God, And behaveth himself proudly against the Almighty;
hmr: Pathien chungah a kut ân let lei le, Iengkimthawthei chunga chapotaka a khawsak leiin.

en: He runneth upon him with a stiff neck, With the thick bosses of his bucklers;
hmr: Ama chunga chun kâwmâwtakin a tlân a, A phaw laipâwng sâtak le chun.

en: Because he hath covered his face with his fatness, And gathered fat upon his loins;
hmr: A thâuna chun a hmai chu ân khum leiin, A diemnêma chun thâu a seng a;

en: And he hath dwelt in desolate cities, In houses which no man inhabited, Which were ready to become heaps;
hmr: Khawpui râusanahai chun a um a, In, mi ihluo nâwnaa hai, Chuong hmunhnawk siekhâwm ni el dinghaia chun.

en: He shall not be rich, neither shall his substance continue, Neither shall their possessions be extended on the earth.
hmr: Hung hausa naw nih a, a thilneihai chu um zing bawk naw ni, An ra suokhai chu hnuoiah kûr thla bawk naw ni.

en: He shall not depart out of darkness; The flame shall dry up his branches, And by the breath of God’s mouth shall he go away.
hmr: Inthima inthawk chun fe suok naw nih a, A kauhai chu mei chun hung sukṭâwl a ta, A baua thuok chun ama chu fe hmang a tih.

en: Let him not trust in vanity, deceiving himself; For vanity shall be his recompense.
hmr: Ama inhlêmin, teplo mei mei chu ring naw raw se, Teplo chu ama thungna ding a ni sih a.

en: It shall be accomplished before his time, And his branch shall not be green.
hmr: A hun tling hmain sukbikim nîng a ta, A kau chu hring naw ni.

en: He shall shake off his unripe grape as the vine, And shall cast off his flower as the olive-tree.
hmr: Grêphrui angin grêp ra hmin naw chu thin thlâng a ta, Oliv thing angin a pâr chu sukṭil a tih.

en: For the company of the godless shall be barren, And fire shall consume the tents of bribery.
hmr: Pathien ngaisak naw pâwl chu an hrût ding a ni sih a, Thamrûkna puon inhai chu meiin kâng hmang a tih.

en: They conceive mischief, and bring forth iniquity, And their heart prepareth deceit.
hmr: Pawitâwkna chu an vawn a, khawhlona chu an nei hlak a, An phîng chun hlêmna a buotsai hlak,” tiin.

en: Then Job answered and said,
hmr: Chun, Job chun a dawn a, a hril tah a,

en: I have heard many such things: Miserable comforters are ye all.
hmr: “Chuong thilhai tamtak chu ka hriet tah a, Thlamuongtu nghawkum in ni vawng a nih.

en: Shall vain words have an end? Or what provoketh thee that thou answerest?
hmr: Teplo thuhai chun tâwp an nei ding am a nih? Annawleh, dawn dingin iengin am a suktho che a?

en: I also could speak as ye do; If your soul were in my soul’s stead, I could join words together against you, And shake my head at you.
hmr: Ka nina hi in nina ni sienla chu, In ṭawng ang bawkin ka ṭawng thei a, In chungah thuhai ka zawmkhâwm thei a, In chungah ka lu ka thin el thei a nih.

en: But I would strengthen you with my mouth, And the solace of my lips would assuage your grief.
hmr: Amiruokchu, ka bauin sukhrât ka ti cheu a, Ka hmûrhaia hnêmna chun i lungngaina chu suknêp a tih.

en: Though I speak, my grief is not assuaged; And though I forbear, what am I eased?
hmr: “Thu ka hrila chu ka lungngaina chu suknêp a ni nawh a, Ka tuor fan fana chu, ieng am ka sâwldam chuong a?

en: But now he hath made me weary: Thou hast made desolate all my company.
hmr: Amiruokchu, tuhin a mi sukrimsitu hin, Ka ruolhai po po chu i mîn pâwlsertir zo an ta hi.

en: And thou hast laid fast hold on me, which is a witness against me: And my leanness riseth up against me, It testifieth to my face.
hmr: Keima chu inchuornain i mi suksip a, Chu chu ka chunga hrietpuinahai chu an nih, Chun, ka derdêpna chu ka chungah a tho a, Ka hmaisan ngeiah a mi kâwk a.

en: He hath torn me in his wrath, and persecuted me; He hath gnashed upon me with his teeth: Mine adversary sharpeneth his eyes upon me.
hmr: A lunginsenin a mi kei nâwi a, a mi hrem tah a; Ka chunga chun a ha a mi râwt khum a, Ka hmêlma chun ka chungah a mitsîr a sukngei a.

en: They have gaped upon me with their mouth; They have smitten me upon the cheek reproachfully: They gather themselves together against me.
hmr: Ka chungah an bau an mi kâk khum a; Hmusittakin ka biengah an mi ben a; Ka chunga chun anni chu an pungkhâwm a.

en: God delivereth me to the ungodly, And casteth me into the hands of the wicked.
hmr: Pathien chun Pathien ngaisak nawhai kuoma chun a mi pêk suok a, Mi rilohai kutahai chun a mi pei lût tah a.

en: I was at ease, and he brake me asunder; Yea, he hath taken me by the neck, and dashed me to pieces: He hath also set me up for his mark.
hmr: Sâwldamin ka um a, ama chun a mi kei nâwi neng a, Anih, ka rîngah a mi man a, innâwi nengin a mi pei tah a. Ama inchikna dinga chun a mi sie ta bawk a.

en: His archers compass me round about; He cleaveth my reins asunder, and doth not spare; He poureth out my gall upon the ground.
hmr: A thalkâptuhai chun ka vêlin an mîn huol a, Ka kalhai chu a sukkawi a, a hla hrim hrim nawh a, Ka mît chu hnuoi chungah a bunthlâk a.

en: He breaketh me with breach upon breach; He runneth upon me like a giant.
hmr: A hlawp hlawpin a mi kei nâwi a, Mi hrât angin ka chunga chun a mi chîl thlûk tah a.

en: I have sewed sackcloth upon my skin, And have laid my horn in the dust.
hmr: Ka vun chunga dingin saiip puon ka ṭhui a, Ka ki chu pilvutah ka sukbal tah a.

en: My face is red with weeping, And on my eyelids is the shadow of death;
hmr: Ka hmai chu ṭapnain a hung sen a, Ka mitreiahai chun thina hlim chu a um a;

en: Although there is no violence in my hands, And my prayer is pure.
hmr: Ka kutahai chun inrawmna a um naw a, Ka ṭawngṭaina chu ân thieng a.

en: O earth, cover not thou my blood, And let my cry have no resting-place.
hmr: “Aw leihnuoi, ka thisen chu inkhum naw la, Ka ṭapna chun châwlhmun nei naw raw se.

en: Even now, behold, my witness is in heaven, And he that voucheth for me is on high.
hmr: Ngai ta, tu khawm hin ka hrietpuina chu vânah a um a, Ka ta dinga hre zingtu chu chungtieng a um a nih.

en: My friends scoff at me: But mine eye poureth out tears unto God,
hmr: Ka ruolhai chun an mi nuisan a; Nisienlakhawm, ka mit chun Pathien kuoma chun mitthli ân sûr a nih.

en: That he would maintain the right of a man with God, And of a son of man with his neighbor!
hmr: Ama chun mihriem nau thuneina chu Pathien kuomah ṭan ta ve sien chu aw! Miin a vênghai a ṭan ang chun.

en: For when a few years are come, I shall go the way whence I shall not return.
hmr: Kum tlâwmte a hung ni pha chun, Lampui ka kîr nâwk nawna dinga chun ka fe âwm sih a.

en: My spirit is consumed, my days are extinct, The grave is ready for me.
hmr: “Ka thlarau chu a kawidar a, ka nihai chu a hung bo tah a, thlân chu keia ta dingin inzosa a nih.

en: Surely there are mockers with me, And mine eye dwelleth upon their provocation.
hmr: Matheiloin, ka kuoma hin nuisantuhai an um a nih, An suklungsennaa chun ka mit chu a châm zing a nih.

en: Give now a pledge, be surety for me with thyself; Who is there that will strike hands with me?
hmr: “Tuhin intiemna siem la, nangma chu ring tlat ngamna che mi siempêk rawh. Chutaka chun tu am kuthai mi benpui ding an um a?

en: For thou hast hid their heart from understanding: Therefore shalt thou not exalt them.
hmr: An lungril chu nangin hrietnaa inthawkin i thuppêk sih a, Chuleiin, nangin anni chu chawimawi naw ti nih.

en: He that denounceth his friends for a prey, Even the eyes of his children shall fail.
hmr: Fâk dinga a ruolhai inthlim chu, A nauhai mithai ngei khawm chu la hlawsam a tih.

en: But he hath made me a byword of the people; And they spit in my face.
hmr: Ama chun mihai hrilinsîmah a mi siem a; Mî chil sâk khum ka hung ni ta hi.

en: Mine eye also is dim by reason of sorrow, And all my members are as a shadow.
hmr: Lungngaina leiin ka mit khawm a hung inthim a; Ka taksaa bunghai po po khawm chu hlim ang an nih.

en: Upright men shall be astonished at this, And the innocent shall stir up himself against the godless.
hmr: Mi tluong chu hitaka hin mak tîng a ta, Mi pawitâwklo chu Pathien ngaisak lo chungah insukthatho a tih.

en: Yet shall the righteous hold on his way, And he that hath clean hands shall wax stronger and stronger.
hmr: Mi fel chun a lampui chu chel zing a ta, Kut faihai neitu chu hung hrât deu deu a tih.

en: But as for you all, come on now again; And I shall not find a wise man among you.
hmr: Amiruokchu, in rêngin kîr unla, tuhin hung ro: Nangni lai mi var ka hmu thei si nawh a,

en: My days are past, my purposes are broken off, Even the thoughts of my heart.
hmr: Ka nihai chu a liem a, ka thiltumhai chu a hung seh a, Ka lungril ngaituohai ngei chu.

en: They change the night into day: The light, say they, is near unto the darkness.
hmr: Zân chu sûnah an inchangtir a: ‘Var chun inthim a hnai tah,’ an tih a.

en: If I look for Sheol as my house; If I have spread my couch in the darkness;
hmr: Seol chu ka in anga ka en chun, Inthima chun ka ṭhunghmun chu ka rem chun;

en: If I have said to corruption, Thou art my father; To the worm, Thou art my mother, and my sister;
hmr: Khur kuoma chun, ‘Ka pa i nih’ ka tih a, Nge kuoma chun, ‘Ka nu le ka farnu i nih’ ka ti bawk chun,

en: Where then is my hope? And as for my hope, who shall see it?
hmr: Ka beiseina chu khâwlai am ni tâng a ta? Ka beiseina chu tuin am hmu tâng a ta?

en: It shall go down to the bars of Sheol, When once there is rest in the dust.
hmr: Seol kawt bulahai chun fe thlâng a ta, Pilvutah châwl hmunkhat tâng kan tih,” tiin.

en: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
hmr: Chun, Bildad Suhi mi chun a dawn a, a hril tah a,

en: How long will ye hunt for words? Consider, and afterwards we will speak.
hmr: “Thuhaia hin ieng chen am remchâng chu în dap ding a na? Ngaituo la, chu hnunga chun thu hril kan tih.

en: Wherefore are we counted as beasts, And are become unclean in your sight?
hmr: Iengdinga ramsahai anga ngaia kan um a, I mithmua hin thieng lo hung ni am kan nih a?

en: Thou that tearest thyself in thine anger, Shall the earth be forsaken for thee? Or shall the rock be removed out of its place?
hmr: Nang le nang i lunginsena insukpuokkhawi che hi; Hnuoi chu nangma ta dingin mâksan a ni ding am a nih? Annawleh, lungpui chu a hmuna inthawka sawn hmang a ni ding am a nih?

en: Yea, the light of the wicked shall be put out, And the spark of his fire shall not shine.
hmr: Anih, mi rilohai varna chu sukthim ni ngei a ta, A meisi khawm chu de ta naw nih.

en: The light shall be dark in his tent, And his lamp above him shall be put out.
hmr: A puon ina var chu inthim a ta, A khâwnvar chu ama chunga chun herhlum nîng a tih.

en: The steps of his strength shall be straitened, And his own counsel shall cast him down.
hmr: Chun, a hrâtna kalchawihai chu suktâwi nîng a ta. Ama thurâwn ngei chun ama chu pei thlâng a tih.

en: For he is cast into a net by his own feet, And he walketh upon the toils.
hmr: Ama kehai ngei chun lêna chun a âwk a; Châng chunga chun a fe sih a.

en: A gin shall take him by the heel, And a snare shall lay hold on him.
hmr: Châng ngul chun a kerîngah man a ta, Châng chun ama chu âwk a tih.

en: A noose is hid for him in the ground, And a trap for him in the way.
hmr: A val chu ama ta ding chun hnuoia thup a na, A châng chu ama ta ding chun lampuia chun kam a nih.

en: Terrors shall make him afraid on every side, And shall chase him at his heels.
hmr: Kil tina chun ṭitumnahai chun ama sukṭîng a ta. A kekhawnghai sir peiin hnawt a tih.

en: His strength shall be hunger-bitten, And calamity shall be ready at his side.
hmr: A hrâtna chu ṭâmsâwl a ta; A sîra chun sietna chu inzosa zing a tih.

en: The members of his body shall be devoured, Yea, the first-born of death shall devour his members.
hmr: A taksa pênghai chu fa zo vawng a ta, Anih, thina nau lutîr chun a pênghai chu fa zo vawng a tih.

en: He shall be rooted out of his tent wherein he trusteth; And he shall be brought to the king of terrors.
hmr: A ringpui puon ina inthawk chun phawi suok nîng a ta, Ṭitumnahai lal kuoma chun hung ṭhuoi ni bawk a tih.

en: There shall dwell in his tent that which is none of his: Brimstone shall be scattered upon his habitation.
hmr: A puon ina chun ama mi ni ngai hlek lo chu chêng a ta, A chêngna hmuna chun meitâwklunghai thêdarin um a tih.

en: His roots shall be dried up beneath, And above shall his branch be cut off.
hmr: A hnuoi tiengah a zunghai chu ṭâwl a ta, A chungtieng chun a kau chu vuoi bawk a tih.

en: His remembrance shall perish from the earth, And he shall have no name in the street.
hmr: Ama hriet zingna chu hnuoi chunga inthawkin bohmang a ta, Kawtthlêra khawm chun hming hrim nei naw ni.

en: He shall be driven from light into darkness, And chased out of the world.
hmr: Vara inthawkin inthimah hnawt hmang nîng a ta, Khawvêla inthawka hnawt suok ni bawk a tih.

en: He shall have neither son nor son’s son among his people, Nor any remaining where he sojourned.
hmr: Naupasal amanih, tupa amani khawm a mihai lai chun nei naw nih a, A înzinnaahai khawm chun iengkhawm nei naw bawk a tih.

en: They that come after shall be astonished at his day, As they that went before were affrighted.
hmr: Ama hnunga hung umhai chun a dam sûng chu mak hung tîng an ta, A hmaa mihai chu sukṭita an lo um ta ang el khan.

en: Surely such are the dwellings of the unrighteous, And this is the place of him that knoweth not God.
hmr: Matheiloin, mi fel lohai chêngna chu chuong ang chu a ni hlak a, Pathien hre naw mi umna hmun chu hieng ang hi a ni hlak,” tiin.

en: Then Job answered and said,
hmr: Chun, Job chun a dawn a, a hril tah a:

en: How long will ye vex my soul, And break me in pieces with words?
hmr: “Ieng chen am ka thla chu in suklâuin, Thuhai chun in mi suknâwi ding a na?

en: These ten times have ye reproached me: Ye are not ashamed that ye deal hardly with me.
hmr: Hieng vawi sâwm rau hi in mi kâwk tah a, Ngartaka in mi thaw hi in inzak naw a ni hi.

en: And be it indeed that I have erred, Mine error remaineth with myself.
hmr: Ka lo suksuol ta ngei a ni chun chu, Ka suksuolna chu keimaa chun um zing el a ta.

en: If indeed ye will magnify yourselves against me, And plead against me my reproach;
hmr: Keia chunga nangni inchawimawi in ni a, Ka demumna keia chunga zawng suok in ni chun,

en: Know now that God hath subverted me in my cause, And hath compassed me with his net.
hmr: Pathien chun ka chungthuah tuhin a mi pei thlâk tah a, A lên chun a mîn khum tah ti hre ro.

en: Behold, I cry out of wrong, but I am not heard: I cry for help, but there is no justice.
hmr: Ngai ta u, ‘Pâwngnêkna,’ tiin ka khêk a, Nisienlakhawm, ngaiin ka um nawh a; Ṭhangpuina dingin ka khêk a, nisienlakhawm, rorêlna dik a um si nawh a.

en: He hath walled up my way that I cannot pass, And hath set darkness in my paths.
hmr: Ka suok thei nawna dingin ka lampui chu ân huon a, Ka lampuiahai chun inthimna chu a sie tah a nih.

en: He hath stripped me of my glory, And taken the crown from my head.
hmr: Ka lua inthawk chun ka lallukhum chu la hmangin, Ka ropuina chu a mi hlîppêk ta a ni hi.

en: He hath broken me down on every side, and I am gone; And my hope hath he plucked up like a tree.
hmr: Kil tina chun a mi hung suksiet a, chuongchun, kei chu ka fe liem tah a; Ka beiseina khawm chu thing ang elin a lâk hmang tah a.

en: He hath also kindled his wrath against me, And he counteth me unto him as one of his adversaries.
hmr: A lunginsenna chu ka chungah a sukchawk a, A hmêlma pakhat ang chun a mi ngai tah a.

en: His troops come on together, And cast up their way against me, And encamp round about my tent.
hmr: A sipaihai chu an hung khâwm a, keima tieng lampui an hung siem a, Ka puon in vêlin ṭhanghmun an khuor a.

en: He hath put my brethren far from me, And mine acquaintance are wholly estranged from me.
hmr: Ka unauhai chu keimaa inthawka hlatakah a sieh a, Ka hmêlhriethai hlak chu keia chungah an inthuruol a.

en: My kinsfolk have failed, And my familiar friends have forgotten me.
hmr: Ka laibunghai hlakin an mi nghatsan a, Ka ruol pâwlngeihai hlakin an mi theinghil ta bawk a.

en: They that dwell in my house, and my maids, count me for a stranger: I am an alien in their sight.
hmr: Ka ina mikhuolhaiin an mi theinghil a, ka siehlawnuhai hlakin ram dang mi angin an mi ngai a,

en: I call unto my servant, and he giveth me no answer, Though I entreat him with my mouth.
hmr: Ka siehlaw chu ka ko a, a mi dawn hrim hrim nawh a, Ama chu bauṭhaa ka ngên a lo ṭûl ta lem a.

en: My breath is strange to my wife, And my supplication to the children of mine own mother.
hmr: Ka thuok chu ka nuhmei kuoma chun mak a lo ni tah a, Ka nu rîla rahai ngei kuoma ka hnina khawm chu nghawkum a lo ni tah a.

en: Even young children despise me; If I arise, they speak against me.
hmr: Naupanghai khawm chun an mi hmusit a, Ka tho leh, ka chungah an mi sawisêl a.

en: All my familiar friends abhor me, And they whom I loved are turned against me.
hmr: Ka ruol bulhai po po hlak chun an mi pâwlser a, Ka hmangai takhai khawm chu ka chungah an hel a.

en: My bone cleaveth to my skin and to my flesh, And I am escaped with the skin of my teeth.
hmr: Ka vun le ka tisa hi ka rua chun a kawp ringawt a, Ka hahai vun ruok chu ka la chang a.

en: Have pity upon me, have pity upon me, O ye my friends; For the hand of God hath touched me.
hmr: Aw nangni ka ruolhai, mi lunginsiet ro, mi lunginsiet ro, Pathien kut chun a mi hung tâwk ta sih a.

en: Why do ye persecute me as God, And are not satisfied with my flesh?
hmr: Pathien ang el chun iengdinga in mi hrem a, Ka tisaa hin lungawi tâwk lo am in nih a?

en: Oh that my words were now written! Oh that they were inscribed in a book!
hmr: “Aw ka thuhai hi tuhin ziekin um sien, Aw, lekhabua chun ziek tlatin um hai sien chu aw!

en: That with an iron pen and lead They were graven in the rock for ever!
hmr: Thîr le suon kawlawm chun ziekin um sien, Lungpuia chun kumkhuoa dingin kerin um hai sien chu!

en: But as for me I know that my Redeemer liveth, And at last he will stand up upon the earth:
hmr: Amiruokchu, ka tlantu chu a hring a nih ti ka hriet a, A tâwpa chun hnuoi chunga hin la ngîr ngei a tih.

en: And after my skin, even this body, is destroyed, Then without my flesh shall I see God;
hmr: Chuong anga ka vun chena sukbohmang a ni hnung khawm chun, Ka taksa ngei chun Pathien chu la hmûng ka tih.

en: Whom I, even I, shall see, on my side, And mine eyes shall behold, and not as a stranger. My heart is consumed within me.
hmr: Ama chu ka ta ding ngeiin hmu tâng ka ta, Ka mithai chun en a ta, mi dang chu en naw ni. Ka lungril chu ka sûnga chun ân tuiral a.

en: If ye say, How we will persecute him! And that the root of the matter is found in me;
hmr: ‘Iengtin am ama chu sukrimsîng ei ti aw! Amaa chun hi thil zung hi hmusuok a nih,’ in ti chun,

en: Be ye afraid of the sword: For wrath bringeth the punishments of the sword, That ye may know there is a judgment.
hmr: Kâwlhnâm chu ṭi ro. Lunginsenna chun kâwlhnâma hremnahai chu a hung lâk suok hlak sih a; Rorêlna chu a um ti in hriet theina dingin,” tiin.

en: Again it came to pass on the day when the sons of God came to present themselves before Jehovah, that Satan came also among them to present himself before Jehovah.
hmr: Ni khat chu Pathien naupahai chu LALPA hmaa an hung inlang- na ni a um nâwk a, Setan khawm chu anni laia LALPA hmaa inlang dingin a hung veh a.

en: And Jehovah said unto Satan, From whence comest thou? And Satan answered Jehovah, and said, From going to and fro in the earth, and from walking up and down in it.
hmr: LALPA chun Setan kuoma chun, “Nang khâwtienga inthawka hung am i na?” a ta. Setan chun LALPA chu a dawn a, “Hnuoia kân vâk vêlnaa le chutaka a suk a tunga inlawnnaa inthawkin,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah said unto Satan, Hast thou considered my servant Job? for there is none like him in the earth, a perfect and an upright man, one that feareth God, and turneth away from evil: and he still holdeth fast his integrity, although thou movedst me against him, to destroy him without cause.
hmr: LALPA chun Setan kuoma chun, “Ka siehlaw Job hi i ngaituo hlak am? Hnuoi chunga hin ama anga mi fel le mi tluong, Pathien ṭi mi le suol nghat- san mi an um si nawh a; a san nei loa ama sukbohmang dinga a chungah i mîn chângtir khawma ama chun a ringumna chu a chel det tlat a nih,” a tih a.

en: And Satan answered Jehovah, and said, Skin for skin, yea, all that a man hath will he give for his life.
hmr: Setan chun LALPA chu a dawn a, “Vun aiah vun; anih, miin a thil nei po po chu a hringna dingin a pêk phal âwm hrim a nih.

en: But put forth thy hand now, and touch his bone and his flesh, and he will renounce thee to thy face.
hmr: Tuhin i kut inlet la, a ru le taksa chu tâwk la, i hmâisanah hrilse ngei ngei a ti che,” a ta.

en: And Jehovah said unto Satan, Behold, he is in thy hand; only spare his life.
hmr: LALPA chun Setan kuomah, “Ngai ta, ama chu i kuta um a nih annâwm; a hringna chau chu hla la,” a ta.

en: So Satan went forth from the presence of Jehovah, and smote Job with sore boils from the sole of his foot unto his crown.
hmr: Chuongchun, Setan chu LALPA hmâihmaa inthawk chun a fe suok tah a, Job chu a kephaa inthawka a lusîp chenin khuoihli pânnain a hrem tah a.

en: And he took him a potsherd to scrape himself therewith; and he sat among the ashes.
hmr: Ama chun ama le ama ân huotna dingin bekawihâr a lâk a; vut lai chun a ṭhung tah a.

en: Then said his wife unto him, Dost thou still hold fast thine integrity? renounce God, and die.
hmr: Chun, a nuhmei chun a kuomah, “I ringumna chu i la chel det tlat el a ni maw? Pathien chu hrilse la, thi el rawh,” a ta.

en: But he said unto her, Thou speakest as one of the foolish women speaketh. What? shall we receive good at the hand of God, and shall we not receive evil? In all this did not Job sin with his lips.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chun a kuomah, “Nuhmei invêt thuhril angin thu i hril a nih. Iengdingin am Pathien kuta inthawka thil ṭha ei hmu chun, thil ṭha naw khawm ei hmu naw ding am a nih?” a ta. Hieng thilhai po poa khawm hin Job chun a hmûrhai khawmin thil a suksuol nawh a.

en: Now when Job’s three friends heard of all this evil that was come upon him, they came every one from his own place: Eliphaz the Temanite, and Bildad the Shuhite, and Zophar the Naamathite; and they made an appointment together to come to bemoan him and to comfort him.
hmr: Chuongchun, Job ruol pathum hai chun ama chunga thil ṭha naw tlunghai po po chu an lo hriet chun, an hmun senga inthawk chun an rêngin an hung seng a; Eliphaz Teman mi le, Bildad Suhi mi le Zophar Naamath mi an nih; ama chu thlamuon ding le tuorpui dinga hung dingin hun rem an ruot tlâng a.

en: And when they lifted up their eyes afar off, and knew him not, they lifted up their voice, and wept; and they rent every one his robe, and sprinkled dust upon their heads toward heaven.
hmr: Chuongchun, râl hlataka in- thawka an mithai an hei inlên chun, ama chu an hriet nawh a, an khêk rak rak a, an ṭap tâwl tah a; an puonhai chu an keithlêr tâwl a, pilvut vân- vawrin an luhai an inthêkhum a.

en: So they sat down with him upon the ground seven days and seven nights, and none spake a word unto him: for they saw that his grief was very great.
hmr: Chuongchun, ama kuoma chun hnuoi chungah ni sari le zân sari an ṭhung a, a tu khawm chun a kuomah iengkhawm an hril nawh a; a lung- ngaina chu a nasa êm êm a nih ti an hmu sih a.

en: Then answered Zophar the Naamathite, and said,
hmr: Chun, Zophar Naamath mi chun a dawn a, a hril tah a.

en: Therefore do my thoughts give answer to me, Even by reason of my haste that is in me.
hmr: “Chuleiin, ka ngaituonahai chun dawnna a mi pêk a nih, Keimaa inhmâwnatak um lei ngei chun.

en: I have heard the reproof which putteth me to shame; And the spirit of my understanding answereth me.
hmr: Kâwkna mi sukzaktak el chu ka lo hriet tah a, Ka hrietthiemna thlarau chun a mi hung dawn tah a nih.

en: Knowest thou not this of old time, Since man was placed upon earth,
hmr: Tienlaia hi thil hi i hriet naw a ni maw, Mihriem chu hnuoi chunga sie a nia inthawk tah,

en: That the triumphing of the wicked is short, And the joy of the godless but for a moment?
hmr: Mi rilohai hnêna chu a tâwi hlak a, Pathien ngaisak lohai hlimna khawm chu mitkhapkâr chau a ni hlak ti hi?

en: Though his height mount up to the heavens, And his head reach unto the clouds;
hmr: A ṭhatna chu vân tawngin intieng sienla khawm, A lu chun sûmhai tawng sienla khawm,

en: Yet he shall perish for ever like his own dung: They that have seen him shall say, Where is he?
hmr: Ama êk ang el chun la hung bohmang ngei a ta, Ama lo hmu hlaktuhai chun, ‘Khâwlai am a um tah a?’ tîng an tih.

en: He shall fly away as a dream, and shall not be found: Yea, he shall be chased away as a vision of the night.
hmr: Mang ang elin vuong hmang a ta, hmu ruol ni ta naw ni, Anih, Zâna mitthlaa thilhmuhai ang el chun hnawt hmang ni tâng a tih.

en: The eye which saw him shall see him no more; Neither shall his place any more behold him.
hmr: Mit ama lo hmu ta hlak khawm chun hmu ta naw nih a, Ama hmun khawm chun hmu ta ngai hrim hrim naw ni.

en: His children shall seek the favor of the poor, And his hands shall give back his wealth.
hmr: A thlahai chun mi rimsihai ditsakna chu zawng tâng an ta, A kuthai chun a hausakna chu pe kîr tâng a tih.

en: His bones are full of his youth, But it shall lie down with him in the dust.
hmr: A ruhai chu a tleirâwlnaa sip a na, Nisienlakhawm, ama leh pilvuta chun zâl tâng a tih.

en: Though wickedness be sweet in his mouth, Though he hide it under his tongue,
hmr: “Rîtlona chu a bauah thlum sien khawm, A lei hnuoia chun thup hlak sienla khawm;

en: Though he spare it, and will not let it go, But keep it still within his mouth;
hmr: Hla zingin, insuoktir hlek loin, A bau sûnga chun kawl zing ta sienla khawm;

en: Yet his food in his bowels is turned, It is the gall of asps within him.
hmr: A bu chu a rîlhai sûnga chun la hung inlet a ta, A sûnga chun rûl tûr hung ning a tih.

en: He hath swallowed down riches, and he shall vomit them up again; God will cast them out of his belly.
hmr: Hausaknahai chu a dawl tah a, hung luok suok nâwk a tih, Pathien chun a phîng sûnga inthawkin hung pei suok a tih.

en: He shall suck the poison of asps: The viper’s tongue shall slay him.
hmr: Rûl tûr chu fâwp a ta, Rûlriel tûrin ama chu sukhlum a tih.

en: He shall not look upon the rivers, The flowing streams of honey and butter.
hmr: Vadunghai chu en ta ngai naw nih a, Nênetui khal le khuoizu tui luonghai chu.

en: That which he labored for shall he restore, and shall not swallow it down; According to the substance that he hath gotten, he shall not rejoice.
hmr: A sininrimna bêk bêk, ra chu pe kîr a ta, lem thla el naw ni, Thil a nei ang hu peiah ama chu hlim naw ni.

en: For he hath oppressed and forsaken the poor; He hath violently taken away a house, and he shall not build it up.
hmr: Mi rimsihai chu a nghatsanin, a nêksâwr a, In dâm chu a pâwng lâk a, a ibâwl naw khawm,

en: Because he knew no quietness within him, He shall not save aught of that wherein he delighteth.
hmr: A duâmna chun to ṭawk ṭawk hrim a hriet naw leiin, A lâwmna tak thil chu hmu bawk naw nih.

en: There was nothing left that he devoured not; Therefore his prosperity shall not endure.
hmr: A fâk zo naw dinga hla hrim thil a um nawh a, Chuleiin, a hausakna chun dai sâwt naw nih.

en: In the fulness of his sufficiency he shall be in straits: The hand of every one that is in misery shall come upon him.
hmr: A hau tâwk zet huna chun inrêkin um a ta, Mi rimsihai kut chu a chungah hung tlung a tih.

en: When he is about to fill his belly, God will cast the fierceness of his wrath upon him, And will rain it upon him while he is eating.
hmr: A phîng chu suksip ding a ni phingleh, Pathien chun a lungsen ṭiumna chu a chungah buok a ta, A fâk lai chun a chungah a sûrin sûr a tih.

en: He shall flee from the iron weapon, And the bow of brass shall strike him through.
hmr: Thîr hriemhreia inthawkin tlânsieng a ta, Dârsen thalngul chun ama kâp thleng a tih.

en: He draweth it forth, and it cometh out of his body; Yea, the glittering point cometh out of his gall: Terrors are upon him.
hmr: A hnûk dawk a, a taksaa inthawk chun a hung suok a; Anih, a hmawrzum tlê chu a mîtkhaa inthawkin a hung suok a, Ṭitumhai chu ama chunga chun a um a nih.

en: All darkness is laid up for his treasures: A fire not blown by man shall devour him; It shall consume that which is left in his tent.
hmr: Inthimna po po chu a rohai dingin siekhâwl a na; Mei, mihriem isêm loin kâng hmang a ta; A puon ina mâksan a la mahla khawm chu kâng hmang a tih.

en: The heavens shall reveal his iniquity, And the earth shall rise up against him.
hmr: Vânhai chun a suolnahai chu suklang a ta, Hnuoi chun ama chunga chun do a tih.

en: The increase of his house shall depart; His goods shall flow away in the day of his wrath.
hmr: A in hlâwkna chun ama mâksan a ta, A lunginsen nia chun a thuomhnawhai chu luong hmang a tih.

en: This is the portion of a wicked man from God, And the heritage appointed unto him by God.
hmr: Hi hi Pathiena inthawka mi rilo chan chu a nih, Pathienin a rochan dinga a ruotpêk chu,” tiin.

en: Then Job answered and said,
hmr: Chun, Job chun a dawn a, a hril tah a:

en: Hear diligently my speech; And let this be your consolations.
hmr: “Ka ṭawng hi nguntakin lo ngai unla, Hi hi in inhnêmna chu ni raw se.

en: Suffer me, and I also will speak; And after that I have spoken, mock on.
hmr: Mi phal unla, kei khawma thu hril vêng ka tih, Ka hril zoah mi nuisan de ti niu.

en: As for me, is my complaint to man? And why should I not be impatient?
hmr: Ka chungthua chun, ka chierna hi mihriem chung am a nih? Iengdingin am lunginrawm loin um ka ta?

en: Mark me, and be astonished, And lay your hand upon your mouth.
hmr: Mi en unla, makti unla, in kutin in bau chu hup el ro.

en: Even when I remember I am troubled, And horror taketh hold on my flesh.
hmr: Ka ngaituoin ka lung a zîng a, Ṭitnain ka tisaah a mi man hlak.

en: Wherefore do the wicked live, Become old, yea, wax mighty in power?
hmr: Iengtiziea mi rilo chu hringin, an hung tarin, thilthawtheinaa an hung nasa hlak am a na?

en: Their seed is established with them in their sight, And their offspring before their eyes.
hmr: An thlahai chu anni mithmu ngeia anni le tungding an na, An chithlahai an mithmu ngeiah, tungding an nih.

en: Their houses are safe from fear, Neither is the rod of God upon them.
hmr: An inhai chu ṭitnaa inthawkin a him a, Pathien hmawl khawm chu an chungah a um bawk nawh.

en: Their bull gendereth, and faileth not; Their cow calveth, and casteth not her calf.
hmr: An bâwngchalhai chun chi an thlah a, an ching ngai nawh a, An bâwngpuihai chun tê an nei a, tê an insiet ngai nawh.

en: They send forth their little ones like a flock, And their children dance.
hmr: An nauhai chu berâm ruol angin an tir suok a, An nauhai chu an lâm a.

en: They sing to the timbrel and harp, And rejoice at the sound of the pipe.
hmr: Ṭingṭang le khuongtê leh hla an sak a, Theihle ria chun an hlim bawk a.

en: They spend their days in prosperity, And in a moment they go down to Sheol.
hmr: An nihai chu neinungtakin an hmang zo a, Thlamuongtakin Seola chun an fe thla tah a.

en: And they say unto God, Depart from us; For we desire not the knowledge of thy ways.
hmr: Pathien kuoma chun, ‘keinia inthawkin fe hmang rawh, I lampuihai hrietna chu kan châk naw a nih,’ an la ti ta rawp a.

en: What is the Almighty, that we should serve him? And what profit should we have, if we pray unto him?
hmr: ‘Iengkimthawthei chu tu am a ni leh, a rawng ei bâwl ding chu? A kuoma ei ṭawngṭaiin ieng am ṭhathnemna hmûng ei ta?’ tiin.

en: Lo, their prosperity is not in their hand: The counsel of the wicked is far from me.
hmr: En ta u, an hausakna chu an kutah a um nawh a; Mi rilo thurâwn chu keimaa inthawka hlataka chun a um a nih.

en: How oft is it that the lamp of the wicked is put out? That their calamity cometh upon them? That God distributeth sorrows in his anger?
hmr: Mi rilohai khâwnvar chu ieng anga herhlum rawpin am a um a? An sietna khawm chu ieng angin am a hung rawp ding? Pathien khawm chun a lunginsenin lungngainahai a pêk tâwl chu?

en: That they are as stubble before the wind, And as chaff that the storm carrieth away?
hmr: Thli hmaa pâwl kûng ang el an na, Busi thliin a lên hmang hlak ang chu an nih.

en: Ye say, God layeth up his iniquity for his children. Let him recompense it unto himself, that he may know it:
hmr: ‘Pathien chun a thlahai ta dingin a khawhlona chu a khâwlkhâwm,’ in ta, An hriet theina dingin an chunga ngei chun thung ni raw se.

en: Let his own eyes see his destruction, And let him drink of the wrath of the Almighty.
hmr: An mithai chun an sietna ngei chu hmu sienla, Iengkimthawthei lunginsenna ngei chu indâwntirin um raw hai se,

en: For what careth he for his house after him, When the number of his months is cut off?
hmr: An thi hnung chun an insûng chu ieng dim ni tâng an ta, An ta dinga thla tiem zât a bo hnung chun?

en: Shall any teach God knowledge, Seeing he judgeth those that are high?
hmr: Mi tukhawmin Pathien chu hrietthiemna ân chûktir ding am a nih, Mi insânghai chunga chun ro a rêl ti hmu siin?

en: One dieth in his full strength, Being wholly at ease and quiet:
hmr: Mi chu a hrât lai takin a thih a, To ṭawk ṭawk le sâwldam rawng rawnga umin.

en: His pails are full of milk, And the marrow of his bones is moistened.
hmr: A taksa chu thâuin a sip a, A ruhai thlin chu a tlawr bawk a.

en: And another dieth in bitterness of soul, And never tasteth of good.
hmr: Chun mi dang lungngaitakin a thih a, Thil ṭha hrim hrim ân tem ngai nawh.

en: They lie down alike in the dust, And the worm covereth them.
hmr: Pilvuta chun angkhat charin an zâl ve veh a, Anni chu ngehai chun ân khum a nih.

en: Behold, I know your thoughts, And the devices wherewith ye would wrong me.
hmr: Ngai ta u, in ngaituohai ka hriet deh Keima chunga indik nawtaka inngaituona remruotnahai le chun.

en: For ye say, Where is the house of the prince? And where is the tent wherein the wicked dwelt?
hmr: ‘Lalnau in chu khâwlai am a na? Mi rilo umna puon in chu khâwlai am a na?’ in ti sih a.

en: Have ye not asked wayfaring men? And do ye not know their evidences,
hmr: Lampuia mi inlawnhai chu in indawn naw am a nih? An thuhrilhai chu in pawm naw am a nih?

en: That the evil man is reserved to the day of calamity? That they are led forth to the day of wrath?
hmr: Mi suol chu suksietna nia dinga khêk a na, Ṭhuoihmangin an um a, lunginsenna nia dingin.

en: Who shall declare his way to his face? And who shall repay him what he hath done?
hmr: Tuin am a lampui chu a hmaisana chun hrilfieng a ta? A thil lo thaw ta chu tuin am thungpêk a ti leh?

en: Yet shall he be borne to the grave, And men shall keep watch over the tomb.
hmr: Thlâna chun ama chu phur hmang la nîng a ta, Thlân in chunga chun la nghâk an tih.

en: The clods of the valley shall be sweet unto him, And all men shall draw after him, As there were innumerable before him.
hmr: Varuom piltlanghai chu ama ta dingin inhnik a ta, Chun, mi po po chun ama hnung chu zui an tih, A hmaa mi tiem sêng lo lo um tahai ang khan.

en: How then comfort ye me in vain, Seeing in your answers there remaineth only falsehood?
hmr: Anleh, iengtin am teplo chun mi thlamuon in ta, In dawnnahaia chun khêl ngawt naw chu iengkhawm a um nawh,” tiin.

en: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
hmr: Chun, Eliphaz Teman mi chun a dawn a, a hril tah a:

en: Can a man be profitable unto God? Surely he that is wise is profitable unto himself.
hmr: “Mihriem chu Pathien ta dingin a ṭhahnem thei ding am a nih? Matheiloin mi var chun ama le ama ân ṭhathnempui hlak ngei a.

en: Is it any pleasure to the Almighty, that thou art righteous? Or is it gain to him, that thou makest thy ways perfect?
hmr: Mi fel i ni hi Iengkimthawthei ta ding chun ieng am lâwmna ding a um a? Annawleh, i lampuihai chu i sukṭha famkim hin ama ta dingin hlâwkna a um am a nih?

en: Is it for thy fear of him that he reproveth thee, That he entereth with thee into judgment?
hmr: Ama i ṭi leiin a hrem chein, Rorêlnaah a ṭhuoi lût che am a nih?

en: Is not thy wickedness great? Neither is there any end to thine iniquities.
hmr: I rîtlona hi a nasa êm êm a ni naw am a nih? I suolnahai chun tâwp chin a nei bawk si nawh a.

en: For thou hast taken pledges of thy brother for nought, And stripped the naked of their clothing.
hmr: I unau thuomhnaw chu teplo khatin i lâk a, Saruokhai chu an silfên i hlîppêk bawk sih a.

en: Thou hast not given water to the weary to drink, And thou hast withholden bread from the hungry.
hmr: Mi chauhai kuoma chun tui dâwn ding i pêk nawh a, Mi phîngṭamhai ta dingin bei în ro bawk a.

en: But as for the mighty man, he had the earth; And the honorable man, he dwelt in it.
hmr: “Amiruokchu, mi thahrât chun chu hnuoi hi a nei a, Mi inzaum chu a sûnga chun a chêng a nih.

en: Thou hast sent widows away empty, And the arms of the fatherless have been broken.
hmr: Hmeithaihai chu kut ruokin în fe hmangtir a, Naufahrahai kuthai chu sukthliekin a um bawk a.

en: Therefore snares are round about thee, And sudden fear troubleth thee,
hmr: Chuleiin, chânghai chu i sîrvêlah a um vawng a nih. Ṭit thutna chun a sukbuoi bawk cheh a.

en: Or darkness, so that thou canst not see, And abundance of waters cover thee.
hmr: I hmu thei nawna dingin i var chu sukthimin a um a, Tui tamtak chun ân khum che a nih.

en: Is not God in the height of heaven? And behold the height of the stars, how high they are!
hmr: Pathien chu vân insânga chun a um a ni naw am a nih? Arasihai insângzie chu ngaituo ta, an insângzie chu!

en: And thou sayest, What doth God know? Can he judge through the thick darkness?
hmr: Nang chun, ‘Pathien chun ieng am a hriet a? Inthim sâmupah ro a rêl thei ding am a nih?

en: Thick clouds are a covering to him, so that he seeth not; And he walketh on the vault of heaven.
hmr: Sûm sâmuphai chu ama inkhumna a na, a hmu thei nawh, Vân vêla chun a fe hlak a nih,’ i ta.

en: Wilt thou keep the old way Which wicked men have trodden?
hmr: Lampui hlui kha i hraw zing ding maw, Mi rilohai lo fena ta kha?

en: Who were snatched away before their time, Whose foundation was poured out as a stream,
hmr: Chuonghai chu an hun hmain lâk hmangin an um a, Chuonghai lungphûm chu tuihnâr anga bunthlâk a ni ta kha.

en: Who said unto God, Depart from us; And, What can the Almighty do for us?
hmr: Pathien kuomah, ‘Keini mi mâksan rawh, Iengkimthawthei chun kan chungah ieng am thaw thei a ta?’ tituhai chu.

en: Yet he filled their houses with good things: But the counsel of the wicked is far from me.
hmr: An inhai chu thil ṭhahaiin a la suksip rawp a, Amiruokchu, mi rilo thurâwn chu keimaa inthawkin hlatakah a um a nih.

en: The righteous see it, and are glad; And the innocent laugh them to scorn,
hmr: Mi felhai chun, chu chu an hmu a, an lâwm a, Mi pawitâwklohai chun hmusitin an nuisan a,

en: Saying, Surely they that did rise up against us are cut off, And the remnant of them the fire hath consumed.
hmr: ‘Eini mi kaltuhai kha sât thlâk an ni ta ngei el a, Anni a la mahlahai khawm chu meiin a kâng hmang a,’ tiin.

en: Acquaint now thyself with him, and be at peace: Thereby good shall come unto thee.
hmr: Tuhin ama le chun inhmêlhriettir la, inremin um rawh, Chuongchun, i ta dingin thil ṭha a hung tlung ding annâwm.

en: Receive, I pray thee, the law from his mouth, And lay up his words in thy heart.
hmr: A baua inthawka inchûktirna chu pawm la, A thuhai chu i lungrilah sie khâwl rawh.

en: If thou return to the Almighty, thou shalt be built up, If thou put away unrighteousness far from thy tents.
hmr: Iengkimthawthei kuomah i kîr nâwk chun, tung ding nîng i ta, I puon inhaia inthawka fel nawna chu hlatakah i sie hmang phawt chun.

en: And lay thou thy treasure in the dust, And the gold of Ophir among the stones of the brooks;
hmr: I hausakna chu pilvuta siein, Ophir rângkachakhai khawm chu vadungtê lunghai lai chun sie rawh.

en: And the Almighty will be thy treasure, And precious silver unto thee.
hmr: Chuongchun, Iengkimthawthei chu i ro hung nîng a ta, I ta dingin tangkaruo hlutak hung nîng a tih.

en: For then shalt thou delight thyself in the Almighty, And shalt lift up thy face unto God.
hmr: Chun, nang chu Iengkimthawtheia chun hlim tâng i ta, Chun, i hmai chu Pathien tieng ngha tâng i tih.

en: Thou shalt make thy prayer unto him, and he will hear thee; And thou shalt pay thy vows.
hmr: I ṭawngṭaina chu ama kuomah siem i ta, ama chun dawn a ti che; Chun, thutiemhai chu ama pe tâng i tih.

en: Thou shalt also decree a thing, and it shall be established unto thee; And light shall shine upon thy ways.
hmr: Thil hung ngiet i ta, chu chu nanga ta dinga thaw ni tâng a tih: Chun, i lampuihaia chun var ta bawk a tih.

en: When they cast thee down, thou shalt say, There is lifting up; And the humble person he will save.
hmr: Pathienin mi chapo chu a sukhnuoi a, Mi inngaitlâwm ruok chu a sandam a.

en: He will deliver even him that is not innocent: Yea, he shall be delivered through the cleanness of thy hands.
hmr: Ama chun pawitâwklo mi ni lo khawm chu sanhim a ta, I kuthai inthiengna leiin sanhim a ni ding a nih,” tiin.

en: Then Job answered and said,
hmr: Chun, Job chun a dawn a, a hril tah a,

en: Even to-day is my complaint rebellious: My stroke is heavier than my groaning.
hmr: “Vawisûn ngei khawm hin ka chierna chu a kha a nih. Kân rûm zing khawmin a kut chu a rik hleh a.

en: Oh that I knew where I might find him! That I might come even to his seat!
hmr: Aw, ama chu ka hmusuok theina hmun chu hre lang chu, A ṭhungphaa ngei chun ka fe thei ding bah!

en: I would set my cause in order before him, And fill my mouth with arguments.
hmr: A hmaa chun ka chungthu chu intlun ka ta, Ka bau chu insêlnain suksip ka tih.

en: I would know the words which he would answer me, And understand what he would say unto me.
hmr: Thu a mi dawnnahai chu hrieng ka ta, Keia kuoma a hrilhai khawm chu hrethiem ka tih.

en: Would he contend with me in the greatness of his power? Nay; but he would give heed unto me.
hmr: A thilthawtheina ropui le chun a mi kal ding am a nih? Kal lo e, kei chu mi ngaisak lem a tih.

en: There the upright might reason with him; So should I be delivered for ever from my judge.
hmr: Chutaka chun mi tluong chun ama le chun ngaituo thei an ta, Chuongchun, ka rorêltua inthawkin kumkhuoin suok tâng ka tih.

en: Behold, I go forward, but he is not there; And backward, but I cannot perceive him;
hmr: Ngai ta u, hmatieng ka feh a, nisienlakhawm, chutaka chun ama a um nawh a. Chun, hnungtieng ka feh a, nisienlakhawm, ama ka hmu thei si nawh a.

en: On the left hand, when he doth work, but I cannot behold him; He hideth himself on the right hand, that I cannot see him.
hmr: Vawitiengah, sin a thaw lai chun, nisienlakhawm, ama ka hmu thei si nawh, Changtienga chun ama chu a lo inbi zing a, ka hmu thei naw a nih.

en: But he knoweth the way that I take; When he hath tried me, I shall come forth as gold.
hmr: Amiruokchu, ama chun lampui ka hraw chu a hriet a, Amain a mi fie pha chun, rângkachak angin hung suok ka tih.

en: My foot hath held fast to his steps; His way have I kept, and turned not aside.
hmr: Ka ke chun a kehnunghai chu a zui tlat a, A lampui chu ka zui a, ka fe pêt ngai nawh.

en: I have not gone back from the commandment of his lips; I have treasured up the words of his mouth more than my necessary food.
hmr: A hmûrhaia inthawka thupêkhaia inthawk chun ka fe pêt ngai nawh a, Ka fâk ding pawimaw nêka nasa lemin a baua thuhai chu ka sie khâwl lem a.

en: But he is in one mind, and who can turn him? And what his soul desireth, even that he doeth.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, ama chu ngaituona thleng lo a na, tuin am ama chu herhmang thei a ta? A lungrilin a nuomtak chu, chu ngei chu a thaw hlak.

en: For he performeth that which is appointed for me: And many such things are with him.
hmr: Thil keia ta dinga ruothai chu a thaw sih a, Chuong ang thil tamtak chu ama kuomah a um a nih.

en: Therefore am I terrified at his presence; When I consider, I am afraid of him.
hmr: Chuleiin, a hmaihmaa chun ka buoi hlak a; Ka ngaituo châng chun, ama chu ka ṭi hlak.

en: For God hath made my heart faint, And the Almighty hath terrified me;
hmr: Pathien chun ka lungril chu a sukchâuin, Iengkimthawthei chun a mi sukbuoi hlak.

en: Because I was not cut off before the darkness, Neither did he cover the thick darkness from my face.
hmr: Inthimna chun a mîn huolvêl a, Inthim sâmup chun ka hmai ân khum si a.

en: Why are times not laid up by the Almighty? And why do not they that know him see his days?
hmr: “Iengkimthawthei chun ieng- dinga rorêlna hunhai chu a ruot naw am a na? Iengdinga ama hretuhai chun a nihai chu an hmu naw am a na?

en: There are that remove the landmarks; They violently take away flocks, and feed them.
hmr: Mihaiin ramrihai an sawn hmang a, Berâm ruolhai chu an pâwng lâk a, an châwm a.

en: They drive away the ass of the fatherless; They take the widow’s ox for a pledge.
