hmr: Fahra sabengtung chu an khal hmang a, Hmeithai bâwngchal chu bat aiah an lâkpêk bawk a.

en: They turn the needy out of the way: The poor of the earth all hide themselves.
hmr: Mi tlasam chu lampuia inthawkin an hnawt hmang a, Hnuoia mi rimsihai chu an inbi hmunkhat tâwl a.

en: Behold, as wild asses in the desert They go forth to their work, seeking diligently for food; The wilderness yieldeth them bread for their children.
hmr: Ngai ta u, thlalêra ram sabengtunghai angin, Fâk ding taimataka zawngin, an sinthaw ding chun an fe suok a; An nauhai ta ding chun thlalêr chun bu a pêk a.

en: They cut their provender in the field; And they glean the vintage of the wicked.
hmr: Mi tin chun an loa bu chu an sîk a, Mi rilohai grêp lâk mahla chu an sîk bawk a.

en: They lie all night naked without clothing, And have no covering in the cold.
hmr: Zânkhawvârin puon boin an zâl a, Deia chun inkhumna ding khawm an nei nawh a.

en: They are wet with the showers of the mountains, And embrace the rock for want of a shelter.
hmr: Tlânghai raw sûrahai chun an huh a, Inhumhimna ditin lungpui chu an bêl a.

en: There are that pluck the fatherless from the breast, And take a pledge of the poor;
hmr: Naute pa nei lo chu nênea inthawkin an lâk hmang a, Mi rimsi naute chu bat aiin an lâkpêk a.

en: So that they go about naked without clothing, And being hungry they carry the sheaves.
hmr: Chuleiin, silfên tlasamin saruokin an invâk a, Buphalhai an put a, nisienlakhawm, an phîng a ṭâm zing a.

en: They make oil within the walls of these men; They tread their winepresses, and suffer thirst.
hmr: An in huon sûngah hriek an siem a, Uoin sâwrnahai chu an chîl a, nisienlakhawm, dangchâr an tuor a.

en: From out of the populous city men groan, And the soul of the wounded crieth out: Yet God regardeth not the folly.
hmr: Khawpuia inthawk chun thisâwnghai chu an inrûm a, Mi hliem hringna chu ṭhangpuina ngênin a khêk suok a. Amiruokchu, Pathien chun an ngênna chu a bengkhawn nawh.

en: These are of them that rebel against the light; They know not the ways thereof, Nor abide in the paths thereof.
hmr: Var chunga helhai chu an um a, Chutaka lampui chu an hriet nawh a, Chutaka lampuihaia chun an chêng bawk nawh.

en: The murderer riseth with the light; He killeth the poor and needy; And in the night he is as a thief.
hmr: Tuolthattu chu vârṭiena thoin, mi tlasam le pasie chu a that a; Zân huna chun inru ang a nih.

en: The eye also of the adulterer waiteth for the twilight, Saying, No eye shall see me: And he disguiseth his face.
hmr: Uiretu mit khawm chun zân thim chu a nghâk a, ‘Mitin mi hmu naw ni,’ tiin: Chuongchun, a hmêl chu a sukdanglam tah a.

en: In the dark they dig through houses: They shut themselves up in the day-time; They know not the light.
hmr: Inthima chun inhai chu an chotlang a, Sûn hun sûnga chun an inkhârkhum a; Var hrim an hriet nawh.

en: For the morning is to all of them as thick darkness; For they know the terrors of the thick darkness.
hmr: Zîngkâr chu an rênga ta ding chun thîna hlim ang a na, Thina hlim ṭitumnahai chu an nêl sih a.

en: Swiftly they pass away upon the face of the waters; Their portion is cursed in the earth: They turn not into the way of the vineyards.
hmr: Tuihai chungzâwla hrâttaka lên an na; An chan chu hnuoia chun ṭawngseinphur a na, Grêp huonhai lampui tieng chun a fe nawh a.

en: Drought and heat consume the snow waters: So doth Sheol those that have sinned.
hmr: Lum le sa chun vûr tuihai chu a lâk hmang a, Chuong ang bawk chun thil suksuoltuhai chu Seol chun a thaw a nih.

en: The womb shall forget him; The worm shall feed sweetly on him; He shall be no more remembered; And unrighteousness shall be broken as a tree.
hmr: Sul chun ama chu theinghil a ta, nge chun inhniktakin ama fâng a tih, Ama chu hriet zing khawm ni ta naw ni; Chun, fel nawna chu thing anga sukthliek ni bawk a tih.

en: He devoureth the barren that beareth not, And doeth not good to the widow.
hmr: Ra insuo ngailo, ching chu a fâk zo a, Hmeithai kuoma chun thil ṭha a thaw ngai nawh.

en: Yet God preserveth the mighty by his power: He riseth up that hath no assurance of life.
hmr: Pathien chun a thilthawtheina chun mi hrât chu a nun a suksei a, Mi tukhawma hring an ring ta naw khawm chu a keitho hlak.

en: God giveth them to be in security, and they rest thereon; And his eyes are upon their ways.
hmr: Hima um dingin Pathien chun anni a pêk a, chutaka chun an sâwldam hlak, Chun, a mithai khawm chu an lampuihaia chun a um zing hlak.

en: They are exalted; yet a little while, and they are gone; Yea, they are brought low, they are taken out of the way as all others, And are cut off as the tops of the ears of grain.
hmr: Chawimawiin an um a, sâwtnawtê sûng chu, chun, an fe liem hlak a, Anih, siehnuoiin an um a, mi danghai ang bawka lampuia inthawka lâk suokin an um hlak a, Chun, buvui hmawrhai anga ât thlâkin an um hlak.

en: And if it be not so now, who will prove me a liar, And make my speech nothing worth?
hmr: Chuong chu a ni naw chun tuin am khêlhlipah mi sie thei an ta? Ka ṭawng khawm chu hlutna nei hlek loah tuin am mi sie thei a ta?” tiin.

en: Then answered Bildad the Shuhite, and said,
hmr: Chun, Bildad Suhi mi chun a dawn a, a hril tah a,

en: Dominion and fear are with him; He maketh peace in his high places.
hmr: “Rorêlna le ṭitna chu ama kuoma chun a um a; A hmun insângahai chun inremna a siem a.

en: Is there any number of his armies? And upon whom doth not his light arise?
hmr: A sipaihai chu iengzât tawp am an ni leh? Anni chunga chun a var chu a suok naw am a nih?

en: How then can man be just with God? Or how can he be clean that is born of a woman?
hmr: Chuong a ni chun iengtin am mihriem chu Pathien hmaa chun mi dik ni thei a ta? Annawleh, nuhmei inei taphawt chu iengtin am inthieng ni thei a ta?

en: Behold, even the moon hath no brightness, And the stars are not pure in his sight:
hmr: Ngai ta, thla khawm khin varna a nei nawh a, Arasihai khawm khi a mithmua chun an inthieng nawh;

en: How much less man, that is a worm! And the son of man, that is a worm!
hmr: Mihriem, chawkchawnâl el chu, a vân thieng naw nâwk zuol awm de! Mihriem naupa, chawkchawnâl el ni chu!” tiin.

en: Then Job answered and said,
hmr: Chun, Job chun a dawn a, a hril tah a:

en: How hast thou helped him that is without power! How hast thou saved the arm that hath no strength!
hmr: “Thilthawtheina nei naw mi chu i va ṭhangpui hlak de! Kut hrâtna nei naw chu i va sanhim hlak de!

en: How hast thou counselled him that hath no wisdom, And plentifully declared sound knowledge!
hmr: Varna nei naw chu i hril var a; Hrietna indiktak chu huntâwk zetin i hrilfie a!

en: To whom hast thou uttered words? And whose spirit came forth from thee?
hmr: Chuong thuhai chu tuin am ân hriltir che a na? Nangmaa inthawka suok chu tu thlarau am a na?

en: They that are deceased tremble Beneath the waters and the inhabitants thereof.
hmr: A thi tahai chu an inthin a, Tuihai le chutaka umhai hnuoia chun.

en: Sheol is naked before God, And Abaddon hath no covering.
hmr: Ama hmaa chun Seol chu saruok a nih, Sietna khawm chun silfên a nei nawh.

en: He stretcheth out the north over empty space, And hangeth the earth upon nothing.
hmr: Hmun ruok chunga chun hmârtieng chu a keiphar a, Leihnuoi chu iengkhawm nilo chungah a khai bawk a,

en: He bindeth up the waters in his thick clouds; And the cloud is not rent under them.
hmr: Tuihai chu a sûm sâtakhai chun a fûn khâwm a, An hnuoia chun sûm chu ân ek si nawh a.

en: He incloseth the face of his throne, And spreadeth his cloud upon it.
hmr: A lalṭhungpha hmai chu ân khum a, A chunga chun a sûm chu ân zâmtir a.

en: He hath described a boundary upon the face of the waters, Unto the confines of light and darkness.
hmr: Tuihai chunga chun ramri a riruong a, Sûn le zân tâwp chinhaia le chun.

en: The pillars of heaven tremble And are astonished at his rebuke.
hmr: Vân banhai chu an inthinin, A kâwknaa chun mak an tih a.

en: He stirreth up the sea with his power, And by his understanding he smiteth through Rahab.
hmr: A thilthawtheinain tuisuoriet chu a sukreh a, A hrietthiemna chun Rahab chu a sukthlûk bawk a;

en: By his Spirit the heavens are garnished; His hand hath pierced the swift serpent.
hmr: A thuok chun vânhai chu cheimawiin a um a; A kut chun rûlpui intawl lai chu a sunthleng tah a.

en: Lo, these are but the outskirts of his ways: And how small a whisper do we hear of him! But the thunder of his power who can understand?
hmr: En ta u, hi hi hman hi a lampuihai a ṭhen chau chu a na, A chanchin chu ei va hriet tlâwm lâwm lâwm ngei de! Nisienlakhawm, a thilthawtheina rihâu chu tuin am hrethiem thei a ta?” tiin.

en: And Job again took up his parable, and said,
hmr: Chun, Job chun a thuhril chu a zawm nâwk a, a hril tah a.

en: As God liveth, who hath taken away my right, And the Almighty, who hath vexed my soul
hmr: “Pathien, ka thiemna thu la hmangtu, Iengkimthawthei, ka lungril sukrimsitu chu a hring zing angin,

en: (For my life is yet whole in me, And the spirit of God is in my nostrils);
hmr: Ka hringna chu keimaa a um sûng phawt le, Pathien thuok chu ka hnarkuohaia a um sûng phawt chun,

en: Surely my lips shall not speak unrighteousness, Neither shall my tongue utter deceit.
hmr: Ka hmûrhai chun fel nawna thu hril dêr naw nih a, Ka lei hin hlêmna thu sâksuok bawk naw ni.

en: Far be it from me that I should justify you: Till I die I will not put away mine integrity from me.
hmr: Nangni thiem kân changtir ding cheu hi Pathien chun a khap a nih; Ka thi hmakhat chun ka lungril tluongna hi keimaa inthawkin sie hmang naw ning.

en: My righteousness I hold fast, and will not let it go: My heart shall not reproach me so long as I live.
hmr: Ka felna chu dêttakin ka chel a, inthla naw ning, Ka dam sûngin ka lungril chun mi sawisêl bawk naw nih.

en: Let mine enemy be as the wicked, And let him that riseth up against me be as the unrighteous.
hmr: Ka hmêlma chu mi rilo ang hung ni sienla, Keima chunga kaltu chu mi fello ang hung ni raw se.

en: For what is the hope of the godless, though he get him gain, When God taketh away his soul?
hmr: Pathien ngaisak naw mi chun hlâwkna insiem fâwm hlak sien khawm, Pathienin a thlarau a lâkpêk pha chun ieng am beisei ding a nei leh?

en: Will God hear his cry, When trouble cometh upon him?
hmr: Pathien chun a khêkri chu a ngai ding am a ni, A chunga buoina a hung tlung pha chun?

en: Will he delight himself in the Almighty, And call upon God at all times?
hmr: Iengkimthawtheia chun ama chu lungawiin, Pathien chu ieng lai khawmin a ko ding am a nih?

en: I will teach you concerning the hand of God; That which is with the Almighty will I not conceal.
hmr: Pathien kut chungthua hin inchûktir ka ti cheu, Iengkimthawthei thiltum chu ip naw ningah.

en: Behold, all ye yourselves have seen it; Why then are ye become altogether vain?
hmr: Ngai ta u, in rêngin in hmu seng tah a; Anleh, iengdinga teplo mei mei in ni vawng el am a na?

en: This is the portion of a wicked man with God, And the heritage of oppressors, which they receive from the Almighty:
hmr: “Hi hi Pathiena mi rilo chan chu a nih; Nêksâwrtuhai rochan, Iengkimthawtheia inthawka an hmu chu.

en: If his children be multiplied, it is for the sword; And his offspring shall not be satisfied with bread.
hmr: A thlahai an hung pung chun, kâwlhnâm ta ding el an nih; A chithlahai chun khawp tâwk bu nei naw ni hai.

en: Those that remain of him shall be buried in death, And his widows shall make no lamentation.
hmr: Ama hnunga la damhai chu thinaa phûm ning an ta, A nuhmei thisanhai (hmeithaihai) khawm chun sûnna siem naw ni hai.

en: Though he heap up silver as the dust, And prepare raiment as the clay;
hmr: Tangka chu pilvut ang elin siekhâwl sien khawm, Silfên chu pilpawk ang elin siem sien khawm;

en: He may prepare it, but the just shall put it on, And the innocent shall divide the silver.
hmr: Buotsai chu buotsai thei a tih, amiruokchu, mi fel chun sil a tih, A tangka khawm chu mi pawitâwk lo chun semdar bawk a tih.

en: He buildeth his house as the moth, And as a booth which the keeper maketh.
hmr: A in chu aium angin a bâwl a. Vêngtuin a sâwlbûk a bâwl ang elin.

en: He lieth down rich, but he shall not be gathered to his fathers; He openeth his eyes, and he is not.
hmr: Mi hausa zâlin a zâl a, amiruokchu, chuong chu ni sawng naw ni, A mithai a hang meng a, a hausakna chu a um ta nawh a.

en: Terrors overtake him like waters; A tempest stealeth him away in the night.
hmr: Tuilien ang elin ṭitnahai chun ama a lâk hmang tah a, Zân kâr chun thlipui chun ama ân rûk hmang tah a.

en: The east wind carrieth him away, and he departeth; And it sweepeth him out of his place.
hmr: Sak thli chun ama chu a lên hmang a, a fe hmang tah a; A hmuna inthawk chun a mût hmang tah a.

en: For God shall hurl at him, and not spare: He would fain flee out of his hand.
hmr: Pathien chun ama chu pei thlâng a ta, hla naw ni, A kuta inthawkin thinthla hmang a tih.

en: Men shall clap their hands at him, And shall hiss him out of his place.
hmr: Mihai chun ama chu kut benkhum an ta, A hmuna inthawk chun ama chu hnawt dawk an tih.

en: Surely there is a mine for silver, And a place for gold which they refine.
hmr: “Tangkaruo ta ding chun cho- suokna hmun chu a um ngei a nih, Rângkachak ta dinga sukthiengna hmun leh.

en: Iron is taken out of the earth, And copper is molten out of the stone.
hmr: Thîr chu leihnuoia inthawka lâk suok a na, Dârsen ruok chu lunga inthawka emtuia lâk suok a nih.

en: Man setteth an end to darkness, And searcheth out, to the furthest bound, The stones of obscurity and of thick darkness.
hmr: Mihriemin inthimna a suktâwp a, Thina hlim le inthimna lung sâmuphai chu, A hmun hlatakahai chun a zawng suok hlak.

en: He breaketh open a shaft away from where men sojourn; They are forgotten of the foot; They hang afar from men, they swing to and fro.
hmr: A ram hluotuhai um nawnaa chun khur an cho a, A chunga fehai chun an theinghil a; Mi hlatnaah an inkhai a, an inthên an inthên a.

en: As for the earth, out of it cometh bread; And underneath it is turned up as it were by fire.
hmr: Hnuoi ruok chu amaa inthawk chun bei a hung suok a, A hnuoitieng chu, inlet chun chu mei ang el a nih.

en: The stones thereof are the place of sapphires, And it hath dust of gold.
hmr: Chutaka lunghai chu Sapphir lung hmun dâm a na, Rângkachak hlawmhai chu a um a nih.

en: That path no bird of prey knoweth, Neither hath the falcon’s eye seen it:
hmr: Chu lampui chu chunglêng vate sa fami chun a hriet nawh a, Mulukawlhai mit khawm chun a hmu ngai nawh.

en: The proud beasts have not trodden it, Nor hath the fierce lion passed thereby.
hmr: Ramsa chapotakhai khawm chun an sir ngai nawh a, Sakeibaknei ṭiumtak khawm chun a hraw ngai nawh.

en: He putteth forth his hand upon the flinty rock; He overturneth the mountains by the roots.
hmr: “A kut chu lungpui changtak chunga chun a sie suok a, Tlânghai chu a bula inthawkin a kei let a.

en: He cutteth out channels among the rocks; And his eye seeth every precious thing.
hmr: Lungpuihai lai chun tuiluongnahai a cho a, A mithai chun thil hlutak chu a hmuh a.

en: He bindeth the streams that they trickle not; And the thing that is hid bringeth he forth to light.
hmr: An far nawna dingin tuihnârhai chu a ting a, Thil inthupa um chu varah a hung lâk suok tah a.

en: But where shall wisdom be found? And where is the place of understanding?
hmr: Amiruokchu, khâwlai am varna chu hmu nîng a ta? Hrietthiemna hmun khawm chu khâwlai am a na?

en: Man knoweth not the price thereof; Neither is it found in the land of the living.
hmr: Mihriem chun chu man chu an hriet nawh a, Mi hring rama khawm chu chu hmu suok a ni bawk nawh.

en: The deep saith, It is not in me; And the sea saith, It is not with me.
hmr: Khursûng chun, ‘Keimaah a um nawh,’ a ta, Tuisuoriet chun, ‘Keimaah a um nawh,’ a ti bawk a.

en: It cannot be gotten for gold, Neither shall silver be weighed for the price thereof.
hmr: Rângkachaka nei thei a ni nawh a, Chu chu man ding chun tangkaruo khawm bûk thei a ni bawk nawh.

en: It cannot be valued with the gold of Ophir, With the precious onyx, or the sapphire.
hmr: Ophir rângkachak le chun ngaihlut inang thei a ni nawh a, Sapphir amanih, Berul lung hlutak le khawm chun hlut inanga ngai thei a ni nawh.

en: Gold and glass cannot equal it, Neither shall it be exchanged for jewels of fine gold.
hmr: Rângkachak le hlimen chun an tluk thei nawh a, Chu chu thlengpui ding chu rângkachak inthiengtaka thleng thei khawm a ni bawk nawh.

en: No mention shall be made of coral or of crystal: Yea, the price of wisdom is above rubies.
hmr: Tuikeplung amanih, lunghlu khawm chu a hrila hril ding a ni nawh a, Anih, Varna man chu lunghlu chun tluk naw nih a,

en: The topaz of Ethiopia shall not equal it, Neither shall it be valued with pure gold.
hmr: Ethiopia rama Topaz lunghlu chun tluk naw nih a, Rângkachak inthieng le khawm chun a hlut angkhata ngai ding a ni nawh.

en: Whence then cometh wisdom? And where is the place of understanding?
hmr: Anleh, varna chu khâwtaka inthawka hung am a na? Hrietthiemna hmun chu khâwlai am ni tâng a ta?

en: Seeing it is hid from the eyes of all living, And kept close from the birds of the heavens.
hmr: Mi hring po po mithmuhaia inthawka thupa umin, Chunga vatehai kâwla khawm thup a nih.

en: Destruction and Death say, We have heard a rumor thereof with our ears.
hmr: Bohmangna le Thina chun, ‘Chu chu thuthang chu kan nahaiin kan lo hriet a,’ an ta.

en: God understandeth the way thereof, And he knoweth the place thereof.
hmr: “Pathien chun chu lampui chu a hriet a, Chu chu hmun khawm chu a hriet a nih.

en: For he looketh to the ends of the earth, And seeth under the whole heaven;
hmr: Ama chun kâwlkawdawnghai chu a hmuh a, Vân khuphnuoi po po hi a hmu vawng a nih.

en: To make a weight for the wind: Yea, he meteth out the waters by measure.
hmr: Thli hrâtnahai chu a pêk lai khan, Anih, tuihai chu inkhinain ân khi suok a nih.

en: When he made a decree for the rain, And a way for the lightning of the thunder;
hmr: Chu lai chun ruo ta ding chun bi a ruotpêkin, Vâninrûm, kâwlinlep ta ding khawma lampui a siempêk bawk a.

en: Then did he see it, and declare it; He established it, yea, and searched it out.
hmr: Chun, ama chun a hmuh a, a puong tah a, A tungding a, anih, a zawng suok bawk a.

en: And unto man he said, Behold, the fear of the Lord, that is wisdom; And to depart from evil is understanding.
hmr: Chun, mihriem kuoma chun, ‘Ngai ta, Lalpa ṭi chu, varna a nih; Suola inthawka fe hmang chu hrietthiemna a ni bawk a,’ a ta,” tiin

en: And Job again took up his parable, and said,
hmr: Chun, Job chun a thuhril chu a zawm nâwk a, a hril tah a:

en: Oh that I were as in the months of old, As in the days when God watched over me;
hmr: “Aw thla hlui tahaia ang khan um la ni lang chu aw, Pathienin a mi vêng lai nihai anga khan;

en: When his lamp shined upon my head, And by his light I walked through darkness;
hmr: A khâwnvar ka lu chungah a var lai, A var ringa inthimna ka fe thleng lai khan;

en: As I was in the ripeness of my days, When the friendship of God was upon my tent;
hmr: Ka vânglai nihaia ka um anga, Pathien thurâwn chu ka puon in chunga a um lai khan;

en: When the Almighty was yet with me, And my children were about me;
hmr: Iengkimthawthei chu ka kuomah a um a, Ka nauhai khawm ka sirah an um lai khan;

en: When my steps were washed with butter, And the rock poured me out streams of oil!
hmr: Ka kaiṭênhai chu nênetui khala sâwp a nih a, Lungpui chun hriek vadunghai chu a min suopêk hlak lai khan!

en: When I went forth to the gate unto the city, When I prepared my seat in the street,
hmr: “Khawpui dai kawtkhâra ka va fe suok a, Kawtthlêra chun ṭhunghmun ka rem chun,

en: The young men saw me and hid themselves, And the aged rose up and stood;
hmr: Tlangvâlhai chun an mi hmuh a, an inbi a, Upahai khawm chu an tho a, an ngîr hlak a,

en: The princes refrained from talking, And laid their hand on their mouth;
hmr: Lalnauhai khawm chun an inbiek an mah a, An kuthai chun an bau chu an hup a;

en: The voice of the nobles was hushed, And their tongue cleaved to the roof of their mouth.
hmr: Mi ṭhahai râwlhai khawm chu a hung reh a, An leihai chu an dang chungah a kawp tah a.

en: For when the ear heard me, then it blessed me; And when the eye saw me, it gave witness unto me:
hmr: Nain a mi hriet chun, mal a mi sâwm hlak sih a, Mit khawma a mi hmu chun, ka kuomah hrietpuina a pêk a;

en: Because I delivered the poor that cried, The fatherless also, that had none to help him.
hmr: Mi rimsi khêk chu ka sansuokin, Fahra ama ṭhangpuitu ding neilo khawm chu ka sansuok hlak leiin,

en: The blessing of him that was ready to perish came upon me; And I caused the widow’s heart to sing for joy.
hmr: A malsâwmna bohmang ṭêp khawm chu ka kuomah a hungin, Hmeithai lungril chu hlima hlasak dingin kân umtir hlak.

en: I put on righteousness, and it clothed me: My justice was as a robe and a diadem.
hmr: Felna chu ka sil a, chu chun a mi thuom a, Ka felna chu lalpuon le lukâwm ang a nih.

en: I was eyes to the blind, And feet was I to the lame.
hmr: Mitdel ta dingin mithai ka na, Kebâi ta dingin kehai ka nih.

en: I was a father to the needy: And the cause of him that I knew not I searched out.
hmr: Tlasam ta dingin pa ka na, Chun, a chungthu ka hriet naw khawm chu ka zawng suok hlak.

en: And I brake the jaws of the unrighteous, And plucked the prey out of his teeth.
hmr: Mi fello ha chu ka sukthliek a, A sa fâk chu a haa inthawk chun ka lâk suok hlak.

en: Then I said, I shall die in my nest, And I shall multiply my days as the sand:
hmr: Chun, ‘Ka bua chun thîng ka ta, Ka nihai chu phaiphin zâtin sukpung ka tih,’ ka tih a.

en: My root is spread out to the waters, And the dew lieth all night upon my branch:
hmr: Ka zung chu tuihai chenin ân zâm a, Ka zâr chunga chun zânkhawvârin dâidaw chu a kûr bawk a.

en: My glory is fresh in me, And my bow is renewed in my hand.
hmr: Ka ropuina chu keimaa chun a thar a, Ka kuta chun ka thalngul chu siemtharin a um bawk a.

en: Unto me men gave ear, and waited, And kept silence for my counsel.
hmr: “Ka kuomah miin na an sit a, an nghâk a, Ka thurâwn chu ngaiin an to hlak.

en: After my words they spake not again; And my speech distilled upon them.
hmr: Ka thu hnungahai chun thu an hril nâwk ta ngai nawh a, Ka ṭawng chu an chungah a tla a.

en: And they waited for me as for the rain; And they opened their mouth wide as for the latter rain.
hmr: Ruo nghâk angin kei an mi nghâk a, Ruo nuhnung tieng nghâk angin an bau an ka lien a.

en: I smiled on them, when they had no confidence; And the light of my countenance they cast not down.
hmr: Anni kân nuipui a, an inring naw laiin, Ka hmêlput hlimum chu an pei thlâk chuong nawh a.

en: I chose out their way, and sat as chief, And dwelt as a king in the army, As one that comforteth the mourners.
hmr: An lampui ka thlang suok a, lal angin ka ṭhung a, Sipai laia lal tak angin ka khawsa a, Mi thlavaihai thlamuongtu ang elin.

en: After this opened Job his mouth, and cursed his day.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun Job chun a bau a kah a, a pieng ni chu ṭawngsie ân phur tah a.

en: And Job answered and said:
hmr: Chun, Job chun a hril tah a:

en: Let the day perish wherein I was born, And the night which said, There is a man-child conceived.
hmr: “Ni, ka piengna ni chu bohmang sienla, ‘Naupasal pâi a nih ie,’ titu zân le chun.

en: Let that day be darkness; Let not God from above seek for it, Neither let the light shine upon it.
hmr: Chu ni chu sukthimin um sienla, Chungtienga inthawkin Pathien khawmin ngaisak naw sienla; A chungah var khawm var bawk naw raw se.

en: Let darkness and the shadow of death claim it for their own; Let a cloud dwell upon it; Let all that maketh black the day terrify it.
hmr: Inthimna le thina hlim chun anni ta ngeiah hau sienla, A chungah sûm zîng tlat raw se; Ni inthimna chun suklâu raw hai se.

en: As for that night, let thick darkness seize upon it: Let it not rejoice among the days of the year; Let it not come into the number of the months.
hmr: Chu zân chu inthim sâmupin man sienla, Chu kum sûng nihaia chun hlimna hrim hrim um naw sienla; Thla nizât tiemnaa khawm ṭhang ve naw raw se.

en: Lo, let that night be barren; Let no joyful voice come therein.
hmr: Anih, chu zân chu zân dawkdâium ni sienla, Chu zâna chun hlim râwl hrim hrim um naw raw se.

en: Let them curse it that curse the day, Who are ready to rouse up leviathan.
hmr: Ni ṭawngsie inphurtuhai chun ṭawngsie inphur raw se, Leviathan sukhar dân thiemhai chun.

en: Let the stars of the twilight thereof be dark: Let it look for light, but have none; Neither let it behold the eyelids of the morning:
hmr: A sîkhawvar chu inthim sienla, Var zawng sienla, hmu bawk naw sienla; Zîngkâr khawfingchat khawm hmu bawk naw raw se.

en: Because it shut not up the doors of my mother’s womb, Nor hid trouble from mine eyes.
hmr: Ka nu sula kawtkhârhai chu a lo khâr nawh a, Ka mithaia inthawkin buoina chu a thup naw bawk leiin.

en: Why died I not from the womb? Why did I not give up the ghost when my mother bare me?
hmr: Sula chun iengdinga ka lo thi naw am a na? Phîng sûnga inthawka ka hung suokin iengdinga thlarau chu lo inthla el naw am ka na?

en: Why did the knees receive me? Or why the breasts, that I should suck?
hmr: Khûphai chun iengdinga an mi lo dawm am a na? Nênehai chun ka nêk ding elin iengdinga an mi lo pawm am a na?

en: For now should I have lain down and been quiet; I should have slept; then had I been at rest,
hmr: Tuhin zâlin to riem riem tâng ka ta, In ka ta, sâwldamin ka um ta ding bah:

en: With kings and counsellors of the earth, Who built up waste places for themselves;
hmr: Hi hnuoia lalhai le rorêltuhai, Anni ta dinga hmun sehai siemtuhai le chun;

en: Or with princes that had gold, Who filled their houses with silver:
hmr: Annawleh, lal nau rângkachak neituhai, An inhai tangkaruoa suksiptuhai le chun.

en: Or as a hidden untimely birth I had not been, As infants that never saw light.
hmr: Annawleh, pieng hun loa thupa um ang ka ni ta ding, Nautê, var hrim hrim hmu ngailohai ang hi.

en: There the wicked cease from troubling; And there the weary are at rest.
hmr: Chutaka chun mi rilo chun a sukbuoina chu ma tâng a ta, Chutaka chun rimsi chu sâwldam tâng a tih.

en: There the prisoners are at ease together; They hear not the voice of the taskmaster.
hmr: Chutaka chun lung in intânghai chu um khâwm dingin an zalên a; Sin inthâwtirtu râwlri khawm an hriet ta ngai nawh.

en: The small and the great are there: And the servant is free from his master.
hmr: Mi lien le mi chîn khawm chutaka chun an um khâwm a; Siehlaw khawm chu a hotua inthawk inthla a ni tah.

en: Wherefore is light given to him that is in misery, And life unto the bitter in soul;
hmr: Iengdinga mi, rimsitaka um kuoma chun var pêk a nih a, Lungrila rimsi tuor kuoma chun hringna pêk am a nih a?

en: Who long for death, but it cometh not, And dig for it more than for hid treasures;
hmr: Thi inhâwk êm êma thi thei si lo a, Ro phûm zawng nêk hmana zawng nasa a,

en: Who rejoice exceedingly, And are glad, when they can find the grave?
hmr: Thlân chu a hmu suok thei pha a, Nasataka hlim êm êm ding kuoma chun?

en: Why is light given to a man whose way is hid, And whom God hath hedged in?
hmr: Iengdinga mi, a lampui thupa um kuoma le, Pathienin paldâi ân huonkhum kuoma chun var pêk am a na?

en: For my sighing cometh before I eat, And my groanings are poured out like water.
hmr: Ka bufâk hmain ka thuokdawngna chu a hung tlung a, Kân rûmnahai chu tui anga bunthlâk an ni hlak sih a.

en: For the thing which I fear cometh upon me, And that which I am afraid of cometh unto me.
hmr: Thil ka iṭi tak chu ka chungah a hung tlung hlak a, Ka înlâu tak chu ka kuomah a hung tlung hlak.

en: I am not at ease, neither am I quiet, neither have I rest; But trouble cometh.
hmr: Inhawiin ka um nawh a, ka to ṭawk ṭawk thei nawh a, Sâwldam ka nei bawk nawh a; buoina a hung tlung lem hlak,” tiin.

en: But now they that are younger than I have me in derision, Whose fathers I disdained to set with the dogs of my flock.
hmr: “Nisienlakhawm, tuhin ka nêka naupang lemhai khawm chun nuizabûrah an mi nei a; An pahai ka ran ruol uihai vêng dinga ka nuiêuhai khan,

en: Yea, the strength of their hands, whereto should it profit me? Men in whom ripe age is perished.
hmr: Anih, an kut thahrâthai chun a ieng chun am mi sukhlâwk a ta? Mi an vânglai hun fe liem ta hi.

en: They are gaunt with want and famine; They gnaw the dry ground, in the gloom of wasteness and desolation.
hmr: Tlâksamna le ṭâmna leiin an inrieng a, Râusanna le sietna hmun thim thlalêr ram chu an tlân a.

en: They pluck salt-wort by the bushes; And the roots of the broom are their food.
hmr: Hna rimtui hnabuk le, Luong zunghai chu an bu dingin an lâk a.

en: They are driven forth from the midst of men; They cry after them as after a thief;
hmr: Mihriem laia inthawka hnawt hmangin an um a, Inru rau ang elin an hnunga chun an rau a.

en: So that they dwell in frightful valleys, In holes of the earth and of the rocks.
hmr: Ruom chadan kârahai le, Hnuoi kuoahai le lungpui pûkahai um dingin.

en: Among the bushes they bray; Under the nettles they are gathered together.
hmr: Hlobuk lai chun an khêk a, Zakthlai buk hnuoia chun an um khâwm a.

en: They are children of fools, yea, children of base men; They were scourged out of the land.
hmr: Invêt nauhai an nih, anih, mi hmangnabohai nauhai an na; Rama inthawk hnawt suok an nih.

en: And now I am become their song, Yea, I am a byword unto them.
hmr: “Tuhin annihai hla chu ka lo ni ta hi; Anih, anni ta dingin ṭawngnaa hmang ka lo ni tah.

en: They abhor me, they stand aloof from me, And spare not to spit in my face.
hmr: An mi pâwlser a, keimaa inthawka hlatakah an ngîr a, Ka hmaia chil mi sâk khum khawm an ma nawh.

en: For he hath loosed his cord, and afflicted me; And they have cast off the bridle before me.
hmr: Ka thalhrui chu a sût a, a mi sukrinum ta leiin, Ka hmaa chun thîrse chu an pei thlâk a.

en: Upon my right hand rise the rabble; They thrust aside my feet, And they cast up against me their ways of destruction.
hmr: Ka changtieng panga chun mi dukdaklo chu a tho a. Ka kehai chu ân tâwlhmang a; Ka chunga chun an bohmangna lampuihai chu an inchuon tah a.

en: They mar my path, They set forward my calamity, Even men that have no helper.
hmr: Ka lampui chu nasatakin an suksiet a, Ka lungngaina chu hma an insâwntir a, Anni chu tukhawmin an khap nawh.

en: As through a wide breach they come: In the midst of the ruin they roll themselves upon me.
hmr: Tui inṭhe huk ang elin an hung a, Suksietna laia chun keia chungah an intêl a.

en: Terrors are turned upon me; They chase mine honor as the wind; And my welfare is passed away as a cloud.
hmr: Ṭitnahai chu ka chungah a hung tlung a, Ka miṭhatna chu thli ang elin an hnawt a, Ka vângneina hlak chu sûm angin a fe liem tah a.

en: And now my soul is poured out within me; Days of affliction have taken hold upon me.
hmr: Tuhin ka lungril chu keia sûnga hin bunthlâkin a um a; Rimsikna nihai chu ka chungah a tlung chie ta a ni hi.

en: In the night season my bones are pierced in me, And the pains that gnaw me take no rest.
hmr: Zân huna chun ka ruhai hin an mi chip an mi chip a, Chuong natna mi chip mi chiphai chu an ma ngai nawh.

en: By God’s great force is my garment disfigured; It bindeth me about as the collar of my coat.
hmr: Ka natna hrâtna nasatak lei chun ka silfên chu a hmêlhem zo a, Ka zakaw rîng angin a mi khuop ta lem a.

en: He hath cast me into the mire, And I am become like dust and ashes.
hmr: Dûmchirhaka chun a mi the lût a, Vut le pilvut ang el ka ni tah a ni hi.

en: I cry unto thee, and thou dost not answer me: I stand up, and thou gazest at me.
hmr: I kuomah ka hung khêk a, nang hlaka i mi dawn nawh a, Ka ngîr a, nangin i mi en nawh a.

en: Thou art turned to be cruel to me; With the might of thy hand thou persecutest me.
hmr: Ka chunga nunse dingin în chang tah a, I kut hrâtna chun i mi hrem a ni ta hi.

en: Thou liftest me up to the wind, thou causest me to ride upon it; And thou dissolvest me in the storm.
hmr: Nang chun thlia chun i mi dawmkâng a, a chunga chun i mîn chuongtir a, Thlipuia chun i mi suktui tah a.

en: For I know that thou wilt bring me to death, And to the house appointed for all living.
hmr: Nang chun thina le, Mi hring po po ta dinga in ruota chun mi ṭhuoi i tih ti ka hriet sih a.

en: Howbeit doth not one stretch out the hand in his fall? Or in his calamity therefore cry for help?
hmr: “Sietna nasatak tuortu chun a kut phar suokin, A sietna chunga chun ṭhangpuina ngaiin a khêk naw ding am a nih?

en: Did not I weep for him that was in trouble? Was not my soul grieved for the needy?
hmr: Mi buoina tâwk ta ding chun ka ṭap hlak a ni naw am a nih? Mi tlasam ta ding khawm chun ka lungril ân rim hlak a ni naw am a nih?

en: When I looked for good, then evil came; And when I waited for light, there came darkness.
hmr: Thil ṭha ka zawng laiin, thil ṭha naw a hung tlung a; Var ka nghâk zing laiin, inthimna a hung tlung bawk a.

en: My heart is troubled, and resteth not; Days of affliction are come upon me.
hmr: Ka lung ân phu hlawp hlawp a, a châwl nawh a; Rimsikna nihai chu ka chungah a hung tlung a ni ta hi.

en: I go mourning without the sun: I stand up in the assembly, and cry for help.
hmr: Nisa ni si loa em dukin ka um a; Inkhâwmna lai chun ka ngîr dawk a, ṭhangpuina ngaiin ka khêk a.

en: I am a brother to jackals, And a companion to ostriches.
hmr: Sihalhai ta dinga unaupa ka lo na, Ostrikhai ta dinga ruolpa leh.

en: My skin is black, and falleth from me, And my bones are burned with heat.
hmr: Ka vun chu a hung dum a, keimaa inthawkin ân khawk a; Ka ruhai chu lumin a kâng bawk a.

en: Therefore is my harp turned to mourning, And my pipe into the voice of them that weep.
hmr: Chuleiin, ka ṭingṭang chu sûnnaah ân chang a, Ka theihle chu mi ṭaphai râwlah ân chang bawk a.

en: I made a covenant with mine eyes; How then should I look upon a virgin?
hmr: “Ka mit leh thuthlung ka siem a, Iengtin am nunghâk chu en tâng ka ta?

en: For what is the portion from God above, And the heritage from the Almighty on high?
hmr: Chungtienga Pathiena inthawka ka chan chu ieng am a na? Chungtienga Iengkimthawtheia inthawka ka rochan chu ieng am a ni leh?

en: Is it not calamity to the unrighteous, And disaster to the workers of iniquity?
hmr: Mi fello ta dingin vângduoina, Rîtlona thawtuhai ta dingin sietna a ni naw am a nih?

en: Doth not he see my ways, And number all my steps?
hmr: Ka lampuihai chu a hmuin, Ka kalchawihai chu a tiem vawng a ni naw am a nih?

en: If I have walked with falsehood, And my foot hath hasted to deceit
hmr: “Chapotaka kal ka chawi a, Ka ke chun hlêmna tieng a pên inhmaw chun;

en: (Let me be weighed in an even balance, That God may know mine integrity);
hmr: (Bûkna indiktaka bûkin mîn umtir sienla, Pathien chun ka ringumna chu a hriet theina dingin)

en: If my step hath turned out of the way, And my heart walked after mine eyes, And if any spot hath cleaved to my hands:
hmr: Ka kalchawi chun lampui a pêtsan a, Ka lungrilin ka mithai chu a zui bawk chun, Ka kuthaiah kaidum hrim a um phawt chun;

en: Then let me sow, and let another eat; Yea, let the produce of my field be rooted out.
hmr: Mîn tûtir la, mi dangin fa raw hai se; Anih, ka lo rasuok chu a zunga kar hmangin um raw se.

en: If my heart hath been enticed unto a woman, And I have laid wait at my neighbor’s door;
hmr: Ka lungril hin nuhmei tieng a ngaisak chun, Ka tuolbâwm kawtkhâr bula kân chân bawk chun;

en: Then let my wife grind unto another, And let others bow down upon her.
hmr: Ka nuhmei hin mi dang kuomah bu râwt sienla, Mi dang chu a chungah bawk raw se.

en: For that were a heinous crime; Yea, it were an iniquity to be punished by the judges:
hmr: Chu chu thuse theidaumtak a ni sih a, Anih, rorêltuin a hrem ding khawpa rîtlona a nih.

en: For it is a fire that consumeth unto Destruction, And would root out all mine increase.
hmr: Bohmangna dinga kâng hmangtu mei chu a ni sih a; Chu chun ka hlâwkna po po chu karphawi vawng a tih.

en: If I have despised the cause of my man-servant or of my maid-servant, When they contended with me;
hmr: Ka siehlawpa amanih, ka siehlawnu amani chungthu ka ngaitha chun, Kei le kan insukbuoi laiin,

en: What then shall I do when God riseth up? And when he visiteth, what shall I answer him?
hmr: Pathien chu hung tho ta sienla ieng am lâwng ka ta? A hung indawn fel pha chun iengin am ama dawn ka ta?

en: Did not he that made me in the womb make him? And did not one fashion us in the womb?
hmr: Sula kei mi siemtu chun ama khawm chu a siem a ni naw am a nih? Sula chun ama chun a mi siemvêl ve ve ni lo am a nih?

en: If I have withheld the poor from their desire, Or have caused the eyes of the widow to fail,
hmr: “Mi rimsi chu an dit zâwng kân ropêk chun, Annawleh, hmeithai mithai chu hlawsam dinga ka siem chun;

en: Or have eaten my morsel alone, And the fatherless hath not eaten thereof
hmr: Annawleh, ka fâk ding chu ka khâta ka fâk a, Fahra chun chutaka mi chu a fâk ve naw chun;

en: (Nay, from my youth he grew up with me as with a father, And her have I guided from my mother’s womb);
hmr: (Ni lo, ka tleirâwla inthawk tah pa kuoma angin ka kuoma inṭhanglien a na, Ka nu sula inthawka kei chu amanu ṭhuoitu chu ka lo ni ta si chun);

en: If I have seen any perish for want of clothing, Or that the needy had no covering;
hmr: Silfên tlasama mi bohmang hrim hrim ka hmu chun, Annawleh, chu tlasam chun silfên a nei hlek naw chun;

en: If his loins have not blessed me, And if he hath not been warmed with the fleece of my sheep;
hmr: A kâwng chun mal a mi lo sâwm ta nawh a, Ka berâmhai hmula ama chu suklum a lo ni ngai naw chun;

en: If I have lifted up my hand against the fatherless, Because I saw my help in the gate:
hmr: Dâikawtkhâra chun ka ṭhangpuina chu ka hmu leia, Fahrahai chu kalin an chungah kut ka lo inlet ta chun;

en: Then let my shoulder fall from the shoulder-blade, And mine arm be broken from the bone.
hmr: Ka liengko hi darphêka inthawkin tla hlawl sienla, Ka bân hi a ruchânga inthawkin tliek raw se.

en: For calamity from God is a terror to me, And by reason of his majesty I can do nothing.
hmr: Pathiena inthawka sietna chu ka ṭi lei le, A ropuina ṭina leiin chuong thilhai chu ka thaw thei naw a nih.

en: If I have made gold my hope, And have said to the fine gold, Thou art my confidence;
hmr: Ka beiseina chu rângkachaka ka siem chun, Rângkachak inthieng kuoma chun, ‘Nang hi ka ringsan tak chu i nih,’ ka ti chun;

en: If I have rejoiced because my wealth was great, And because my hand had gotten much;
hmr: Ka hausakna hi a hung nasat lei a ka hlim a, Ka kut chun tamtak a hung hmu leia ka lâwm a ni chun,

en: If I have beheld the sun when it shined, Or the moon walking in brightness,
hmr: Nisa chu vartaka a var lei le, Thla chu vartaka a fê lai ka thlîr a;

en: And my heart hath been secretly enticed, And my mouth hath kissed my hand:
hmr: Ka lungril chu inrûka hîpa a um a, Ka bau chun ka kut chu a fâwp chun;

en: This also were an iniquity to be punished by the judges; For I should have denied the God that is above.
hmr: Hi khawm hi rîtlona rorêltuin a hrem ding chu a nih: Chunga um Pathien chu ka hlêm a ni ding an sih a.

en: If I have rejoiced at the destruction of him that hated me, Or lifted up myself when evil found him
hmr: “Keia mi theidatu sietnaa chun ka hlim a, Annawleh, ama chu thil ṭha nawin a hmu suok phaa kân sie chung chun;

en: (Yea, I have not suffered my mouth to sin By asking his life with a curse);
hmr: (A hringna ta dinga ṭawngsie inphura, Suksuol dingin ka bau chu ka phal nawh)

en: If the men of my tent have not said, Who can find one that hath not been filled with his meat?
hmr: Ka puon ina mihai chun, ‘A tisa saw ei nei naw chun khawp tâwk nâwm ei ni,’ an ti naw chun,

en: (The sojourner hath not lodged in the street; But I have opened my doors to the traveller);
hmr: (Mikhuol chu kawtthlêra chun a riek nawh a; Amiruokchu, mikhuol ta ding chun ka kawtkhâr chu ka hawng lem hlak).

en: If like Adam I have covered my transgressions, By hiding mine iniquity in my bosom,
hmr: Mihai anga ka bawsietnahai chu ka ip a, Ka ângsûnga ka rîtlona chu thupa kân khum chun;

en: Because I feared the great multitude, And the contempt of families terrified me, So that I kept silence, and went not out of the door—
hmr: Mipui nasatakhai chu ka ṭih a, Sûngkaw inpâwina chun a mi suklâu bawk a; Ka to ṭawk a, kawtkhâr khawm ka suok ngam naw a ni chun,

en: Oh that I had one to hear me! (Lo, here is my signature, let the Almighty answer me) And that I had the indictment which mine adversary hath written!
hmr: Aw ka thu mi ngaipêk ding hi chu um hai sien! (En ta u, hitaka hin ka hming ziek a um a, Iengkimthawthei chun mi dawn raw se;) Ka hmêlmain a ziek, hêkna lekhabu chu nei lang chu aw!

en: Surely I would carry it upon my shoulder; I would bind it unto me as a crown:
hmr: Matheiloin ka liengkoah put ka ta, Lukhum angin keimaa chun khitde ngei ngei ka tih;

en: I would declare unto him the number of my steps; As a prince would I go near unto him.
hmr: Ka kalchawi ni zât chu ama kuomah hrilfieng ka ta; Lal nau angin ama hnaiah fêng ka tih.

en: If my land crieth out against me, And the furrows thereof weep together;
hmr: Ka ram chu ka chungah a khêk a, A changkuonghai chu an ṭap a;

en: If I have eaten the fruits thereof without money, Or have caused the owners thereof to lose their life:
hmr: Chutaka rahai chu tangka boa ka fâk chun: Annawleh, a neituhai chu chutaka chun an hringna inhmang khawpa a siem chun;

en: Let thistles grow instead of wheat, And cockle instead of barley. The words of Job are ended.
hmr: Bu nêkin hlingbuk ṭo lem sienla, buṭei nêkin buor ṭo lem raw se,” tiin. Job thuhrilhai chu a tâwp tah.

en: So these three men ceased to answer Job, because he was righteous in his own eyes.
hmr: Chuongchun, hi mi pathum hai hin Job an dawnna chu an tâwp tah a, ama mithmua chun a fel tlat si leiin.

en: Then was kindled the wrath of Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite, of the family of Ram: against Job was his wrath kindled, because he justified himself rather than God.
hmr: Ram hnama mi Buz mi Barakel naupa Elihu lung chu a sen tah a; a lunginsenna chu Job chungah a nih a hung sat chu, ama le ama chu Pathien nêka thiem ân changtir tlat leiin.

en: Also against his three friends was his wrath kindled, because they had found no answer, and yet had condemned Job.
hmr: A ruolhai pathum chunga khawm a lunginsenna chu a hung sa bawk a, dawnna ding hmu suok si loin, Job chu thiemnaw an inchangtir si leiin.

en: Now Elihu had waited to speak unto Job, because they were elder than he.
hmr: Tuhin Elihu chun Job kuoma thuhril ding chu a nghâk a, ama nêka anni chu an upa lem leiin.

en: And when Elihu saw that there was no answer in the mouth of these three men, his wrath was kindled.
hmr: Chun, Elihu chun chuong mi pathum hai baua inthawk chun dawnna hrim a um naw ti a hmu chun a lunginsenna chu a hung zuol tah a.

en: And Elihu the son of Barachel the Buzite answered and said, I am young, and ye are very old; Wherefore I held back, and durst not show you mine opinion.
hmr: Chun, Elihu Buz mi Barakel naupa chun a dawn a, a hril tah a: “Kei naupang ka na, nangni chu upatak in na; Chuleiin, kân sûm a, ka ngaidân chu in kuomah kân entir ngam naw cheu a nih.

en: I said, Days should speak, And multitude of years should teach wisdom.
hmr: ‘Nihai chun hung hril a ta, Kumhai tamna chun varna inchûktir naw nîm,’ ka lo ta.

en: But there is a spirit in man, And the breath of the Almighty giveth them understanding.
hmr: Amiruokchu, mihriema chun thlarau a um a, Iengkimthawthei chun a thuokin anni chu hrietthiemna a pêk a ni lem a.

en: It is not the great that are wise, Nor the aged that understand justice.
hmr: Mi ropuihai chu an var chuong kher nawh a, Mi upahai chun thudik chu an hrietthiem vawng kher bîk nawh.

en: Therefore I said, Hearken to me; I also will show mine opinion.
hmr: Chuleiin, ‘Kei mi ngai unla, Kei khawma ka ngaidân inhriettir ka tih’, ka ti a nih.

en: Behold, I waited for your words, I listened for your reasonings, Whilst ye searched out what to say.
hmr: “Ngai ta u, in thuhai chu ka nghâk zing a, In thuhril sanhai ka lo ngai zing a, Ieng am hril ding tia in zawng sûng po khan.

en: Yea, I attended unto you, And, behold, there was none that convinced Job, Or that answered his words, among you.
hmr: Anih, in kuomah ka um zing a. Chun, ngai ta u, nangni lai tukhawm Job thuhne hrim hrim in um dêr nawh a. Annawleh, nangni lai a thuhai dawn thei hrim in um dêr naw a nih.

en: Beware lest ye say, We have found wisdom; God may vanquish him, not man:
hmr: ‘Varna kan hmu suok tah, Mihriem ni loin, Pathien chun a namhnuoi a nih’, ti hlau rawi in tih.

en: For he hath not directed his words against me; Neither will I answer him with your speeches.
hmr: A thuhai chu keima kal zâwngin ân kâwltir nawh a, In thuhrilhai angin kei khawmin ama chu dawn bawk naw ning.

en: They are amazed, they answer no more: They have not a word to say.
hmr: Anni chun mak an ti tah a, an dawn ta hrim hrim nawh a, Thu bau khat khawm hril ding hrim an nei ta nawh a.

en: And shall I wait, because they speak not, Because they stand still, and answer no more?
hmr: Thu an hril ta naw leiin, An ngîr ṭawk ṭawk a, an dawn ta hrim hrim naw leiin, ka nghâk ding maw?

en: I also will answer my part, I also will show mine opinion.
hmr: Kei khawma ka chana chun dawn vêng ka ta, Kei khawma ka ngaidân chu inentir vêng ka tih.

en: For I am full of words; The spirit within me constraineth me.
hmr: Thuhaiin ka sip sih a; Ka sûnga thlarau hin a mi tirlui a nih.

en: Behold, my breast is as wine which hath no vent; Like new wine-skins it is ready to burst.
hmr: Ngai ta u, ka sûng chu uoin hu suokna nei lo ang chu a nih; Peng tharhai puokkawi ṭêp ding ang chu.

en: I will speak, that I may be refreshed; I will open my lips and answer.
hmr: Ka sâwl a dam huoina dingin thu hril ka ta, Ka bau kain dawn ka tih.

en: Let me not, I pray you, respect any man’s person; Neither will I give flattering titles unto any man.
hmr: Ka hni cheu hi, mi tukhawm mi nina chu mîn zâtir naw unla, Mi tukhawm kuomah hming ṭha tehlêm chu pe bawk naw ning.

en: For I know not to give flattering titles; Else would my Maker soon take me away.
hmr: Inpâk tehlêm chu ka thiem si nawh a, Chuong naw chun, kei mi Siemtu hin mi la hmang vak rawi a tih.

en: Howbeit, Job, I pray thee, hear my speech, And hearken to all my words.
hmr: “Chuleiin, Job, ka ngên che hi, ka thuhril hi lo ngai la, Ka thuhai po po khawm lo ngai vawng ta.

en: Behold now, I have opened my mouth; My tongue hath spoken in my mouth.
hmr: Tuhin ngai ta, ka bau chu ka kah a, Ka bau sûnga chun ka leiin thu a hril ta hi.

en: My words shall utter the uprightness of my heart; And that which my lips know they shall speak sincerely.
hmr: Ka thuhai chun ka lungril tluongziehai chu hril suok a tih; Ka hmûrhaiin an thil hriet chu takinningtakin hril bawk an tih.

en: The Spirit of God hath made me, And the breath of the Almighty giveth me life.
hmr: Pathien Thlarau chun a mi siem a, Iengkimthawthei thuok chun hringna a mi pêk a.

en: If thou canst, answer thou me; Set thy words in order before me, stand forth.
hmr: I thei chun chu kei mi dawn la, Ka hmaa hin i thuhai chu ân dawtin hung suklangin târ suok rawh.

en: Behold, I am toward God even as thou art: I also am formed out of the clay.
hmr: Ngai ta, nangma ang bawkin kei khawm Pathien tienga ṭhang ka na, Kei khawm pilpawka inthawka siem ka nih.

en: Behold, my terror shall not make thee afraid, Neither shall my pressure be heavy upon thee.
hmr: Ngai ta, ka ṭitumna chun nang suklâu naw ni cheh a, I chungah ka hnengna che hi rik talaw bawk naw nih.

en: Surely thou hast spoken in my hearing, And I have heard the voice of thy words, saying,
hmr: “Matheiloin ka hrieta khawm i hril a, I thuhai ri chu hienga hrilin ka lo hriet ta bawk a,

en: I am clean, without transgression; I am innocent, neither is there iniquity in me:
hmr: ‘Bawsietna nei loin kân thieng a nih, Pawitâwklo ka na, keimaa hin rîtlona hrim a um bawk nawh,

en: Behold, he findeth occasions against me, He counteth me for his enemy;
hmr: Ngai ta, ka chungah remchâng hun hmuin, A hmêlmaah a mi ruot tah a.

en: He putteth my feet in the stocks, He marketh all my paths.
hmr: Ka kehai chu kawl a mîn bun a, Ka lampuihai po po chu ân chik tlat bawk a,’ i tih a.

en: Behold, I will answer thee, in this thou art not just; For God is greater than man.
hmr: Ngai ta, dawn ka ti che, hitaka hin în dik naw a nih; Pathien chu mihriem nêkin a ropui lem sih a.

en: Why dost thou strive against him, For that he giveth not account of any of his matters?
hmr: Ama chunga chun iengdinga i hel am a na? Mihriem thu iengkhawm a dawn nawh tiin.

en: For God speaketh once, Yea twice, though man regardeth it not.
hmr: Pathien chun vawi khat thu a hril a, Anih, vawi hni khawm, miin ngaisak naw hai sien khawm.

en: In a dream, in a vision of the night, When deep sleep falleth upon men, In slumberings upon the bed;
hmr: Mangah, zâna mitthlaa thilhmua, Îmu indêntakin mihai chu a hung zêl phah a, Khum chunga îmu inhniktaka a in lai chun a hril a.

en: Then he openeth the ears of men, And sealeth their instruction,
hmr: Mihai nahai chu a hawngpêk a, Zillâwknahai chun anni a sukṭi hlak.

en: That he may withdraw man from his purpose, And hide pride from man;
hmr: Mihriem chu a thiltuma inthawka a lâk hmang theina ding le, Mihriema inthawka chapona chu a thup theina dingin;

en: He keepeth back his soul from the pit, And his life from perishing by the sword.
hmr: A thla chu khursûnga inthawka a lâk kîr theina dingin le, A hringna chu kâwlhnâma bohmangnaa inthawka a lâkkîr theina dingin.

en: He is chastened also with pain upon his bed, And with continual strife in his bones;
hmr: “A khum chunga chun natna khawma thunun a na, A ruhaia naa chip zingna leh.

en: So that his life abhorreth bread, And his soul dainty food.
hmr: Chuongchun, a hringna chun bei chu a theida a, A lungril chun sa a ten a.

en: His flesh is consumed away, that it cannot be seen; And his bones that were not seen stick out.
hmr: A taksa chu kâng hmangin a um a, hmu thei a ni nâwk ta naw a; A ruhai hmu thei lohai khawm chu a hung dâwk a.

en: Yea, his soul draweth near unto the pit, And his life to the destroyers.
hmr: Anih, a thlarau chun khursûng chu a hnai a; A hringna chun suksetuhai chu a hnai bawk a.

en: If there be with him an angel, An interpreter, one among a thousand, To show unto man what is right for him;
hmr: A kuoma chun vântirko um sienla, Palai, sâng khat laia pakhat chu, Mihriem kâwla ama ta dinga ân dik chu inentir dingin;

en: Then God is gracious unto him, and saith, Deliver him from going down to the pit, I have found a ransom.
hmr: Ama chun a chunga chun zângaiin, ‘Khur sûnga fenaa inthawkin ama chu sanhim ro, Intlanna ka hmu suok tah a.

en: His flesh shall be fresher than a child’s; He returneth to the days of his youth.
hmr: A tisa chu naupang tisa nêkin tharlâm lem sien, A tleirâwl lai nihaiah kîr nâwk raw se’ ti sienla,

en: He prayeth unto God, and he is favorable unto him, So that he seeth his face with joy: And he restoreth unto man his righteousness.
hmr: Pathien kuoma chun ṭawngṭai sienla, ama chun lo dawn a tih, Chuongchun, a hmêl chu hlimin um a tih, Mi kuoma chun a felna chu a pêk kîr nâwk ding leiin.

en: He singeth before men, and saith, I have sinned, and perverted that which was right, And it profited me not:
hmr: Mihai hmaa chun hla sak tâng a ta; ‘Ka lo suksuol tah a, ân dik chu ka lo fe hmangsan tah a, Anachu a mi hung thung kher nawh a:

en: He hath redeemed my soul from going into the pit, And my life shall behold the light.
hmr: Khursûng a fenaa inthawkin ka thlarau chu a sanhim a, Ka hringna chun var chu hmûng a tih,’ tiin.

en: Lo, all these things doth God work, Twice, yea thrice, with a man,
hmr: “En ta, hieng po po hi Pathien chun a thawh a, Vawi hni, anih, vawi thum, mihriema chun a thaw a nih.

en: To bring back his soul from the pit, That he may be enlightened with the light of the living.
hmr: Khursûnga inthawka a thlarau chu hung ṭhuoi kîr ding le, Hringna vara chun ama chu sunvar a ni theina dingin.

en: Mark well, O Job, hearken unto me: Hold thy peace, and I will speak.
hmr: Inchik ṭha ta, aw Job, kei mi ngai ta, Lo to ṭawk ṭawk la, thu hril ka tih.

en: If thou hast anything to say, answer me: Speak, for I desire to justify thee.
hmr: Iengkhawm hril ding i nei chun mi hung dawn la, Thu hril ta, nang chu thiem inchangtir che ka nuom sih a,

en: If not, hearken thou unto me: Hold thy peace, and I will teach thee wisdom.
hmr: Chuong a ni naw leh, kei mi ngai la, Lo to ṭawk ṭawk la, varna inchûktir ka ti che,” tiin.

en: Moreover Elihu answered and said,
hmr: Chun, Elihu chun a hril a:

en: Hear my words, ye wise men; And give ear unto me, ye that have knowledge.
hmr: “Nangni mi varhai, ka thuhai hi lo ngai ta u; Nangni hrietna neituhai, keia tieng in na lo sit ta u.

en: For the ear trieth words, As the palate tasteth food.
hmr: Dangin fâk ding ân tem ang bawkin, Na chun thuhai chu a fie hlak sih a.

en: Let us choose for us that which is right: Let us know among ourselves what is good.
hmr: Ân dik taphawt chu eini ta dingin thlang ei ta. A ṭha chu eini lai hre bawk ei tiu khai.

en: For Job hath said, I am righteous, And God hath taken away my right:
hmr: Job chun, ‘Kei chu ka fel a nih, Pathien chun ka thiemna chu a lâk hmang tah a.

en: Notwithstanding my right I am accounted a liar; My wound is incurable, though I am without transgression.
hmr: Ka thiemna chunga chun kân khêl ding am a nih? Bawsietna bo ni lang khawm, ka hliemna chu sukdam thei lo a nih,’ a ti sih a.

en: What man is like Job, Who drinketh up scoffing like water,
hmr: Job ang hi mi tu am an um a, Hmusitna tui ang ela dâwn a,

en: Who goeth in company with the workers of iniquity, And walketh with wicked men?
hmr: Rîtlona thawtuhai le hmunkhata feh a, Mi rilohai le intlawn hlak chu?

en: For he hath said, It profiteth a man nothing That he should delight himself with God.
hmr: Ama chun, ‘Mihriem ta dingin ieng khawm a ṭhahnem nawh,’ ti siin, Pathiena chun ama chu a lâwm chu.

en: Therefore hearken unto me, ye men of understanding: Far be it from God, that he should do wickedness, And from the Almighty, that he should commit iniquity.
hmr: Chuleiin, nangni hrietthiemna neihai, mi lo ngai ta u, Rîtlona thâwng a tih ti hi Pathiena inthawka hlatak a ni ding a na, Suolna thâwng a tih ti hi, Iengkimthawtheia inthawka hlatak a ni ding a nih.

en: For the work of a man will he render unto him, And cause every man to find according to his ways.
hmr: Mi chu a sinthaw ang peiin ama kuomah a pêk ding a na, A lampuihai ang peiin mi tin chu ân hmutir ding a ni hi.

en: Yea, of a surety, God will not do wickedly, Neither will the Almighty pervert justice.
hmr: Anih, matheiloin, Pathien chun rilotakin thaw naw tawp a ta, Iengkimthawthei chun rorêlna chu sukdanglam bawk naw ni.

en: Who gave him a charge over the earth? Or who hath disposed the whole world?
hmr: Hnuoi chunga enkawl dingin tuin am thu a pêk a? Annawleh, khawvêl pumpui hi tuin am a chungah ân nghat leh?

en: If he set his heart upon himself, If he gather unto himself his spirit and his breath;
hmr: Ama le ama chunga chun a lung inkîr lêt sienla, Ân thuokna le a thlarau chu ama kuoma chun la khâwm sienla chu;

en: All flesh shall perish together, And man shall turn again unto dust.
hmr: Tisa po po chu bohmang vawng an ta, Mihriem chu pilvuta bawk kîr nâwk el a tih.

en: If now thou hast understanding, hear this: Hearken to the voice of my words.
hmr: “Tuhin, hrietthiemna i nei chun chu, hi hi lo ngai la, Ka thuhai ri chu lo ngai raw khai.

en: Shall even one that hateth justice govern? And wilt thou condemn him that is righteous and mighty?—
hmr: Indikna theidatu chun ro a rêl ding am a nih? Mi indik le mi hrât chu i dem ding am a ni,

en: Him that saith to a king, Thou art vile, Or to nobles, Ye are wicked;
hmr: Lal kuomah, ‘I suol a nih’ tih a, Mi ṭhahai kuomah, ‘In rilo a nih’ titu;

en: That respecteth not the persons of princes, Nor regardeth the rich more than the poor; For they all are the work of his hands.
hmr: Lalnauhai khawm inza biklo, Hausahai khawm mi rimsi nêka ngaisâng chuong lotu chu? An rêngin a kutsuokhai an ni sih a.

en: In a moment they die, even at midnight; The people are shaken and pass away, And the mighty are taken away without hand.
hmr: Mitkhapkâr loin an thih a, zânrila ngei khawm; Mihai chu sukhnîngin an um a, an fe hmang tah a; Mi thilthawtheihai khawm chu kut ṭhangloa lâkin an um bawk a.

en: For his eyes are upon the ways of a man, And he seeth all his goings.
hmr: A mithai chu mihriem lampuihai chunga chun a fuh a, A fe vêl po po khawm chu a hmu zing a.

en: There is no darkness, nor thick gloom, Where the workers of iniquity may hide themselves.
hmr: Thina hlim amanih, inthimna amanih khawm a um nawh, Thil khawhlo thawtuhai an inbîkna ding hmun chu.

en: For he needeth not further to consider a man, That he should go before God in judgment.
hmr: Mihriem chunga chun chantâwk bâk nêka nasa chu innghat naw nih a, Pathien hmaa chun rorêlnaah a fe ding a nih.

en: He breaketh in pieces mighty men in ways past finding out, And setteth others in their stead.
hmr: Mi hrâthai chu a nawi tiem sêngloin suknawi a ta, An aiah mi danghai sie thung a tih.

en: Therefore he taketh knowledge of their works; And he overturneth them in the night, so that they are destroyed.
hmr: Chuleiin, an sinthawhai chu a hriet a, Zâna chun ân letling a, chuongchun, suksiet an ni tah a.

en: He striketh them as wicked men In the open sight of others;
hmr: Mi rilohai angin anni a vuok a, Mi danghai mithmua chun;

en: Because they turned aside from following him, And would not have regard in any of his ways:
hmr: Ama chu zui dinga an pêthmangsan lei le A lampuihai chu pakhat khawm an ngaisak naw leiin.

en: So that they caused the cry of the poor to come unto him, And he heard the cry of the afflicted.
hmr: Chuongchun, mi rimsi khêk ri chu ama kuom an intlungtir a, Chun, ama chun sukrimsia um khêk ri chu a lo hriet a.

en: When he giveth quietness, who then can condemn? And when he hideth his face, who then can behold him? Alike whether it be done unto a nation, or unto a man:
hmr: To ṭawk ṭawka a um laiin, tuin am dem thei an ta? Chun, a hmai a thup lai chun tuin am ama chu hmu thei an ta? Hnam pumpui chunga thaw amanih mi pakhat chunga thaw amani khawm ni sien, angkhat a nih.

en: That the godless man reign not, That there be none to ensnare the people.
hmr: Pathien ngaisak naw mi chun ro rêl naw sien chu, Mihai chu a âwk ding tukhawm um naw ni hai.

en: For hath any said unto God, I have borne chastisement, I will not offend any more:
hmr: Mi tukhawma Pathien kuomah an ti ta hlak am, ‘Thununna chu ka tuor tah a, suklungsen nâwk ta ngai dêr naw ning;

en: That which I see not teach thou me: If I have done iniquity, I will do it no more?
hmr: Ka hmu nawhai chu nangin mîn chûktir la, Suolna lo thaw tah ka ni chun, thaw ta ngai naw ning,’ tiin.

en: Shall his recompense be as thou wilt, that thou refusest it? For thou must choose, and not I: Therefore speak what thou knowest.
hmr: A thungna chu i nuom angtak chu a ni ding maw, nang chun i kal vei a? Nang chun i thlang ding a nih, kei ni loin; Chuleiin, i hriet chu hril rawh.

en: Men of understanding will say unto me, Yea, every wise man that heareth me:
hmr: Mi, hrietthiemna nei mihai chun ka kuoma hieng hin tîng an ta, Anih, mi var tinhai kei mi lo ngai hlakhai chun;

en: Job speaketh without knowledge, And his words are without wisdom.
hmr: ‘Job chun hrietna nei loin thu a hril a. A thuhai chu varna bo a nih,’ tiin.

en: Would that Job were tried unto the end, Because of his answering like wicked men.
hmr: Job chu a tâwp chena fie ni sienla aw, Mi rilohai anga a dawnna leiin.

en: For he addeth rebellion unto his sin; He clappeth his hands among us, And multiplieth his words against God.
hmr: A suolnaa chun helna chu a belsaa, Eini lai hin a kuthai a ben a, A thuhai chu Pathien chunga chun a sukpung tah a,” tiin.

en: Moreover Elihu answered and said,
hmr: Chun, Elihu chun a hril a,

en: Thinkest thou this to be thy right, Or sayest thou, My righteousness is more than God’s,
hmr: “Hi hi indikin i ngaituo am a nih? Annawleh, ‘Ka felna chu Pathien felna nêkin a nasa lem,’ i ti am a nih?

en: That thou sayest, What advantage will it be unto thee? And, What profit shall I have, more than if I had sinned?
hmr: ‘I ta dingin ieng am a ṭhatna a um a? Ka suksuol naw hi ieng am ka hlâwkna a um a?’ i ti a nih.

en: I will answer thee, And thy companions with thee.
hmr: Nanga kuoma i ruolhai le, Nang ka hung dawn ding che a nih.

en: Look unto the heavens, and see; And behold the skies, which are higher than thou.
hmr: Vânhai tieng khi ngha la, en ta; Sûmhai khi en ta, nanga nêkin an insâng lem a nih.

en: If thou hast sinned, what effectest thou against him? And if thy transgressions be multiplied, what doest thou unto him?
hmr: Thil suol i lo thaw ta chun, ama chungah ieng am i thawh a? I bawsietnahai chu a hung pung chun, ieng am i thawpêk a?

en: If thou be righteous, what givest thou him? Or what receiveth he of thy hand?
hmr: I fel a ni chun, ama chu ieng am i pêk a? Annawleh, i kuta inthawkin ama chun ieng am a hmuh a?

en: Thy wickedness may hurt a man as thou art; And thy righteousness may profit a son of man.
hmr: I rîtlona chun nangma ang bawkin mi a sukna thei a, Chun, i felna chun mihriem naupa chu a sukhlâwk thei a nih.

en: By reason of the multitude of oppressions they cry out; They cry for help by reason of the arm of the mighty.
hmr: “Nêksâwrna tamtakhai lei chun an khêk a, Mi hrât bân leiin ṭhangpuina ngênin an khêk bawk a.

en: But none saith, Where is God my Maker, Who giveth songs in the night,
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, tukhawma, ‘Kei a mi Siemtu Pathien chu khâwlai am a um a, Zâna khawm hlahai pe hlaktu chu?

en: Who teacheth us more than the beasts of the earth, And maketh us wiser than the birds of the heavens?
hmr: Ama hnuoia ramsahai nêka mîn chûktir nasa lem a, Chunglêng vatehai nêka var lema mi siemtu chu?’ an ti nawh.

en: There they cry, but none giveth answer, Because of the pride of evil men.
hmr: Chutaka chun an khêk a, nisienlakhawm, tukhawmin dawnna an pêk nawh, Mi suolhai chapona lei chun.

en: Surely God will not hear an empty cry, Neither will the Almighty regard it.
hmr: Matheiloin, Pathien chun teplo mei mei chu ngai naw nih a, Iengkimthawthei chun ngaisak bawk naw ni.

en: How much less when thou sayest thou beholdest him not, The cause is before him, and thou waitest for him!
hmr: Nangin ama chu ka hmu nawh i ti lem hin chu a ni naw âwm nasa de! Rorêlna chu ama hmaa um a ni sih a, ama chu ring el rawh.

en: But now, because he hath not visited in his anger, Neither doth he greatly regard arrogance;
hmr: Amiruokchu, tuhin, a lunginsennain a hung hrem nawh a, Chapona chu a ngaisak bawk nawh a;

en: Therefore doth Job open his mouth in vanity; He multiplieth words without knowledge.
hmr: Chuleiin, Job hin teplo mei meiin a bau chu a kah a, Hrietna nei loin thuhai chu a sukpung a ni hi,” tiin.

en: Elihu also proceeded, and said,
hmr: Elihu chun a zawm pei a, a hril a:

en: Suffer me a little, and I will show thee; For I have yet somewhat to say on God’s behalf.
hmr: “Mi lo daw hrâm la, inentir ka ti che; Pathien hmingin hril ding ṭhenkhat ka nei sih a.

en: I will fetch my knowledge from afar, And will ascribe righteousness to my Maker.
hmr: Hlataka inthawkin ka hrietna hung lâng ka ta, Felna chu keia mi Siemtu kuomah inentir ka tih.

en: For truly my words are not false: One that is perfect in knowledge is with thee.
hmr: Indiktakin, ka thuhai hi ân khêl si nawh a; Mi hrietna famkim nei chu i kuomah a um a nih.

en: Behold, God is mighty, and despiseth not any: He is mighty in strength of understanding.
hmr: Ngai ta, Pathien chu thilthawthei a na, tukhawm a hmusit ngai nawh a, Hrietna hrâtnaa thilthawthei a nih.

en: He preserveth not the life of the wicked, But giveth to the afflicted their right.
hmr: Mi rilo hringna chu a hla nawh a; Amiruokchu, sukrimsia umhai kuoma chun an thuneina chu a pêk a nih.

en: He withdraweth not his eyes from the righteous: But with kings upon the throne He setteth them for ever, and they are exalted.
hmr: Mi fela inthawk chun a mithai a lâk kîr ngai nawh a, Amiruokchu, lalṭhungphaah lalhai leh an um a; Kumkhuoin anni chu a tungding a, chawimawi an ni hlak.

en: And if they be bound in fetters, And be taken in the cords of affliction;
hmr: Kawlhai inbuntira an um a, Sukrinumna hruihaia kei an ni chun;

en: Then he showeth them their work, And their transgressions, that they have behaved themselves proudly.
hmr: An sinthaw le an bawsietnahai le, Chapotakin an lo khawsak tâkzie ân entir hlak.

en: He openeth also their ear to instruction, And commandeth that they return from iniquity.
hmr: Inchûktirna tieng chun an na chu a sukvarpêk a, Suolnaa inthawka kîr dingin thu a pêk hlak.

en: If they hearken and serve him, They shall spend their days in prosperity, And their years in pleasures.
hmr: Chu chu an ngai a, ama rawng an bâwl chun, an nihai chu hausaknain hmang zo an ta, An kumhai chu nuomsipnain.

en: But if they hearken not, they shall perish by the sword, And they shall die without knowledge.
hmr: Amiruokchu, an ngâi naw chun, kâwlhnâmin bohmang an ta, Hrietna boin thîng an tih.

en: But they that are godless in heart lay up anger: They cry not for help when he bindeth them.
hmr: Nisienlakhawm, chuong lungrila Pathien ngaisak nawhai chun lunginsenna an khâwlkhâwm a, Anni a khuop pha khawm ṭhangpuina ngênin an khêk nawh.

en: They die in youth, And their life perisheth among the unclean.
hmr: Vânglaiin an thih a, An hringna chu mi dukdaklohai lai a bohmang tah a.

en: He delivereth the afflicted by their affliction, And openeth their ear in oppression.
hmr: Sukrimsia umhai chu a sukrimsiknain a sanhim a, Nêksâwrnain an nahai chu a sukvar tah a.

en: Yea, he would have allured thee out of distress Into a broad place, where there is no straitness; And that which is set on thy table would be full of fatness.
hmr: Anih, rimsiknaa inthawk chun nang chu ṭhuoi hmang a ti cheh a, Inchêpna umlo, hmun lientaka chun; Chun, i dawkâna siea um chu thâunain sip tâng a tih.

en: But thou art full of the judgment of the wicked: Judgment and justice take hold on thee.
hmr: Amiruokchu, nang chu mi rilo rorêla sip i ni tah a, Rorêlna le indikna chu nangmaa chun ân phun tah a nih.

en: For let not wrath stir thee up against chastisements; Neither let the greatness of the ransom turn thee aside.
hmr: Lunginsenna a um leiin, indittâwkna chun ṭhuoi hmang hlau a che, fîmkhur rawh; Intlanna nasatak chun nang chu hnâwlhmang bâwk naw raw se che.

en: Will thy cry avail, that thou be not in distress, Or all the forces of thy strength?
hmr: Rimsia i um nawna dingin i hausaknahai chu a huntâwk am a nih? Annawleh, i thahrui hrâtnahai po po chu a hun am a nih?

en: Desire not the night, When peoples are cut off in their place.
hmr: Zân chu dit naw la, Chu huna chun mihai chu an hmuna sât thlâk an ni hlak.

en: Take heed, regard not iniquity: For this hast thou chosen rather than affliction.
hmr: Fîmkhur la, suolna chu ngaisak naw, Sukrimsia umna nêkin hi hi i thlang ta sih a.

en: Behold, God doeth loftily in his power: Who is a teacher like unto him?
hmr: Ngai ta, Pathien chun a thilthawtheinain insângtakin a thawh a, Ama ang inchûktirtu tu am an um a?

en: Who hath enjoined him his way? Or who can say, Thou hast wrought unrighteousness?
hmr: Tuin am a lampui a ruotpêk thei a? Annawleh, ‘Thil fel lo i thaw a nih,’ tuin am ti thei a ta?

en: Remember that thou magnify his work, Whereof men have sung.
hmr: “A sinthaw chawimawi hlak ding chu hre zing la, Mihai khawma hlaa an inpâk hlak chu.

en: All men have looked thereon; Man beholdeth it afar off.
hmr: Mihai po po chun chu chu an en a, Mi chun hlataka inthawkin a hmuh a.

en: Behold, God is great, and we know him not; The number of his years is unsearchable.
hmr: Ngai ta, Pathien chu a ropui a, ama chu ei hriet naw a nih; A kum tamzie khawm chu zawng suok ruollo a nih.

en: For he draweth up the drops of water, Which distil in rain from his vapor,
hmr: Tui farhai chu chungtieng a lâk kâng a; Chuong chu, a tuihua inthawk chun ruoah an far thla sih a.

en: Which the skies pour down And drop upon man abundantly.
hmr: Chuongchun, vânhai chun a hung bunthlâk a; Mi chunga chun tamtakin ân sûrtir a.

en: Yea, can any understand the spreadings of the clouds, The thunderings of his pavilion?
hmr: Anih, mi tu bêkin amanih sûmhai inzar ziehai hi hre thei a ti, A biekbûk vâninrûmhai chu?

en: Behold, he spreadeth his light around him; And he covereth the bottom of the sea.
hmr: Ngai ta, ama vêla chun a var chu a phar a; Tuisuoriet limawng chu ân khum tah a.

en: For by these he judgeth the peoples; He giveth food in abundance.
hmr: Hieng thilhai hin mipuihai ro chu a rêl sih a, Ama chun fâk ding tamtakin a pêk a.

en: He covereth his hands with the lightning, And giveth it a charge that it strike the mark.
hmr: A kuthai chu kâwlinlepin ân khum a, A tumna tak fu dingin thu a pêk a.

en: The noise thereof telleth concerning him, The cattle also concerning the storm that cometh up.
hmr: A vâninrûm chun thlipui hung chu a hril a, Ran ruol chen khawmin thlipui hung thu chu an hril a.

en: Yea, at this my heart trembleth, And is moved out of its place.
hmr: “Hitaka khawm hin ka lungril chu ân thin a, A umna hmuna inthawk chun ân châwm a.

en: Hear, oh, hear the noise of his voice, And the sound that goeth out of his mouth.
hmr: A râwl ri chu ngai ta u, A baua inthawka ri suok le chun,

en: He sendeth it forth under the whole heaven, And his lightning unto the ends of the earth.
hmr: Vân hnuoi po poa chun a tir suok a; A kâwlinlep chu hnuoi tâwpnahai chenin a tir suok bawk a.

en: After it a voice roareth; He thundereth with the voice of his majesty; And he restraineth not the lightnings when his voice is heard.
hmr: Chu hnunga chun râwl chu ân rih a, A ropuina râwl chun a hung sukri tah a; A râwl chu hriet a ni pha chun anni chu ân châwltir nawh a.

en: God thundereth marvellously with his voice; Great things doeth he, which we cannot comprehend.
hmr: Pathien chun a râwlin nasatakin a sukrih a; Thil ei hmu thei naw ropuitakhai chu a thaw a nih.

en: For he saith to the snow, Fall thou on the earth; Likewise to the shower of rain, And to the showers of his mighty rain.
hmr: Vûr kuoma chun, ‘Hnuoiah tla rawh,’ a ta; Chuong ang bawkin ruo mal kuoma le A ruo nasa sûrhai kuoma chun a ti bawk a.

en: He sealeth up the hand of every man, That all men whom he hath made may know it.
hmr: Mi tin kut chu a khârkhip a, Mi po pohai a siemhai chun an hriet theina dingin.

en: Then the beasts go into coverts, And remain in their dens.
hmr: Chun, ramsahai chu pûkahai chun an feh a, An kuoahai chun an um zing a.

en: Out of the chamber of the south cometh the storm, And cold out of the north.
hmr: Simtieng pindana inthawk chun thlipui a hung a, Hmârtienga inthawkin phalbi a hung bawk a.

en: By the breath of God ice is given; And the breadth of the waters is straitened.
hmr: Pathien thuok chun vûr inkhal chu a pêk a Tui lientakhai khawm an inkhal zo a.

en: Yea, he ladeth the thick cloud with moisture; He spreadeth abroad the cloud of his lightning:
hmr: Anih, sûm sâtak chu tuihuin a sukrik a, A kâwlinlep sûm chu a thedar tah a.

en: And it is turned round about by his guidance, That they may do whatsoever he commandeth them Upon the face of the habitable world,
hmr: Chun, a ṭhuoinain ân let vêl a, Thu a pêk taphawt an thaw theina dingin; Khawvêl hluo theia um chung po poa chun.

en: Whether it be for correction, or for his land, Or for lovingkindness, that he cause it to come.
hmr: A hnuoi ta dingin amanih, sukdikna lem dingin amanih, Annawleh, zângaina leiin amani a hungtir hlak a.

en: Hearken unto this, O Job: Stand still, and consider the wondrous works of God.
hmr: “Aw Job, hi hi ngai ta, To veng vengin Pathien sinthaw maktakhai chu ngaituo ta.

en: Dost thou know how God layeth his charge upon them, And causeth the lightning of his cloud to shine?
hmr: An chunga chun Pathien chun ieng angin am maw ân phurtirin, A sûm kâwlinlep chu ân vartir hlak ti i hriet am?

en: Dost thou know the balancings of the clouds, The wondrous works of him who is perfect in knowledge?
hmr: Sûm rikziehai chu i hriet am, Hrietna famkima sip, sinthaw maktak el chu?

en: How thy garments are warm, When the earth is still by reason of the south wind?
hmr: Sim thli leia hnuoi chu a um ṭawk ṭawk laiin, Iengtin am i silfênhai chu suklumin a um a, ti i hriet am?

en: Canst thou with him spread out the sky, Which is strong as a molten mirror?
hmr: Ama ang chun vân khi keiphar thei i ti, Dârthlalang sungta anga ngar khi?

en: Teach us what we shall say unto him; For we cannot set our speech in order by reason of darkness.
hmr: Ama kuoma chun ieng am kan hril ding mîn chûktir la, Inthimna leiin kan thuhril chu kan sukrem thei si nawh a.

en: Shall it be told him that I would speak? Or should a man wish that he were swallowed up?
hmr: Thu ka hril ding a nih ti chu ama hril a ni ding am a nih? Annawleh, mi chun lem zoa um chu a nuom am a nih?

en: And now men see not the light which is bright in the skies; But the wind passeth, and cleareth them.
hmr: Tuhin mihai chun vânhaia var chu an hmu naw a nih; Amiruokchu, thli a hrâng a, anni chu a sukthiel hlak.

en: Out of the north cometh golden splendor: God hath upon him terrible majesty.
hmr: Hmârtienga inthawkin rângkachak ropuina chu a hung a; Pathien chu ropuina ṭiumtakin ân thuom a.

en: Touching the Almighty, we cannot find him out: He is excellent in power; And in justice and plenteous righteousness he will not afflict.
hmr: Iengkimthawthei chu ei hmu suok thei nawh, Thilthawtheina le indiknaah a ropui a, Felna a hau a, nêksâwr naw nih.

en: Men do therefore fear him: He regardeth not any that are wise of heart.
hmr: Chuleiin, mihai chun ama chu an ṭih a, Lungrila vara inngaihai khawm chu a pawisa chuong nawh,” tiin.

en: Then Jehovah answered Job out of the whirlwind, and said,
hmr: Chun, thlivira inthawkin LALPA chun Job chu a hung dawn a, a hril tah a:

en: Who is this that darkeneth counsel By words without knowledge?
hmr: “Hrietna bo thuhaia, Thurâwn sukthimtu hi tu am a ni leh?

en: Gird up now thy loins like a man; For I will demand of thee, and declare thou unto me.
hmr: Pasal angin tuhin i dier kei la, Thu indawn ka ti cheh a, i mi hrilfie ding a nih.

en: Where wast thou when I laid the foundations of the earth? Declare, if thou hast understanding.
hmr: Hnuoi lungphûmhai ka phûm laiin nang chu khaw lai am i um a? Hriethiemna i nei chun mi hril rawh.

en: Who determined the measures thereof, if thou knowest? Or who stretched the line upon it?
hmr: Tuin am chu chu lienziehai chu a riruong a, I hriet ngei maw! Annawleh, a chunga chun tuin am a thlûr chu a siem a?

en: Whereupon were the foundations thereof fastened? Or who laid the corner-stone thereof,
hmr: A lungphûmhai chu khâwlai am an innghat a na? Annawleh, a kia lung chu tuin am a phûm a?

en: When the morning stars sang together, And all the sons of God shouted for joy?
hmr: Zîng arasihai chun hla an sak tâwlin, Pathien naupahai chu iengtik khan am hlimin an khêk a?

en: Or who shut up the sea with doors, When it brake forth, as if it had issued out of the womb;
hmr: Annawleh, sula inthawka a hung ṭe thla laiin, Tuisuoriet chu tuin am kawtkhârhai chu a khârpêk a;

en: When I made clouds the garment thereof, And thick darkness a swaddling-band for it,
hmr: Sûm chu a silfênah ka siem a, Inthim sâmupa ka tuom lai khan;

en: And marked out for it my bound, And set bars and doors,
hmr: A ramrihai ka ruotpêk a, Kawtkhârhai le palhai ka sie a;

en: And said, Hitherto shalt thou come, but no further; And here shall thy proud waves be stayed?
hmr: ‘Hi chen hi nang hung la, khêl naw la, I tuifâwn chapotakhai chu hi chen hin châwl an tih’ ka ti lai khan?

en: Hast thou commanded the morning since thy days began, And caused the dayspring to know its place;
hmr: “I nihai inṭana inthawk ta hrimin, zîngkâr dâm hi thu i pêk ta hlakin, Vârṭien chu a hun hre dingin în umtir ta hlak am,

en: That it might take hold of the ends of the earth, And the wicked be shaken out of it?
hmr: Hnuoi inkhumna chu hlîm ding le, A sûnga mi rilo chu sêpdawka a um theina dingin?

en: It is changed as clay under the seal; And all things stand forth as a garment:
hmr: Namna hnuoia pilpawk angin sukdanglamin a um a, Silfên angin piengzie a hung nei a.

en: And from the wicked their light is withholden, And the high arm is broken.
hmr: Mi riloa inthawkin an var chu cheltângin a um a, Kut insâng khawm chu sukthliekin a um bawk a.

en: Hast thou entered into the springs of the sea? Or hast thou walked in the recesses of the deep?
hmr: Tuisuoriet hnârahai chun i lût ta hlak am? Annawleh, li inthûk rila chun i fe ta hlak am?

en: Have the gates of death been revealed unto thee? Or hast thou seen the gates of the shadow of death?
hmr: Thina kawtkhârhai chu i kuomah suklang a ni ta hlak am? Annawleh, thina hlim kawtkhârhai chu i hmu hlak am?

en: Hast thou comprehended the earth in its breadth? Declare, if thou knowest it all.
hmr: Hnuoi khang lienzie chu i hriet ta hlak am? Hril rawh khai, a rênga i hriet vawng chun.

en: Where is the way to the dwelling of light? And as for darkness, where is the place thereof,
hmr: Var umna hmun lampui chu khâwlai am a na? Inthimna hi teh, a umna hmun khâwlai am a na?

en: That thou shouldest take it to the bound thereof, And that thou shouldest discern the paths to the house thereof?
hmr: Chutaka chun i va fe ding ni ta sienla, Chutaka in chu i va thlierhran ding ni ta sienla?

en: Doubtless, thou knowest, for thou wast then born, And the number of thy days is great!
hmr: I hriet ngei maw, nang chu i pieng dai tah a, I nihai khawm a hung tam ta êm a!

en: Hast thou entered the treasuries of the snow, Or hast thou seen the treasures of the hail,
hmr: Vûr intling khâwmnahaia chun i lût ta hlak am? Annawleh, riel intling khâwmnahai chu i hmu ta hlak am?

en: Which I have reserved against the time of trouble, Against the day of battle and war?
hmr: Chuong buoina huna dinga ka khêkhai le, Indona le intukna nia dinga ka khêkhai chu?

en: By what way is the light parted, Or the east wind scattered upon the earth?
hmr: Ieng lampui âm var hi a fein, Annawleh, hnuoi chunga hin ieng lampui âm sak thli hi a hrâng hlak a?

en: Who hath cleft a channel for the waterflood, Or the way for the lightning of the thunder;
hmr: “Tuin am tuilien ta dinga ruom le, Ṭêk ta ding a lampui a siem a?

en: To cause it to rain on a land where no man is; On the wilderness, wherein there is no man;
hmr: Mi um nawna ram le, Mi um nawna thlalêra ruo insûrtir ding le.

en: To satisfy the waste and desolate ground, And to cause the tender grass to spring forth?
hmr: Leihnuoi râusan ta le, se ta chu sukkhawp ding le, Hlohna innêm chu hung inmâwngtir dingin?

en: Hath the rain a father? Or who hath begotten the drops of dew?
hmr: Ruo hin pa a nei am? Annawleh, daidaw malhai hi tuin am a hung thlâk a na?

en: Out of whose womb came the ice? And the hoary frost of heaven, who hath gendered it?
hmr: Tu phîng sûnga inthawkin am vûr chu a hung pieng a na? Vâna inthawka vûrsûr inphi sung sung chu tuin am ân pieng tir leh?

en: The waters hide themselves and become like stone, And the face of the deep is frozen.
hmr: Tuihai chu lung angin a ngar a, Li inthûk chungzâwl chu sukkhalin a um tah a.

en: Canst thou bind the cluster of the Pleiades, Or loose the bands of Orion?
